original: @1b # // rgya gar skad du //
analyzed: @1b # // rgya gar skad du //
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: shr'i badzra m'a la ma h'a yo ga tantra t'i k'a gam bh'i r'rtha dhi pi ka n'a ma /
analyzed: shr'i badzra m'a la ma h'a yo ga tantra t'i k'a gam bh'i r'rtha dhi pi ka n'a ma /
translated: Śrī-vajra-mālā-mahāyoga-tantra-tīkā-gambhīrārtha-dīpikā-nāma.

original: bod skad du //
analyzed: bod skad du //
translated: In Tibetan:

original: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rje phreng ba'i rgya cher 'grel pa zab mo'i don gyi 'grel pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rje phreng ba'i rgya cher 'grel pa zab mo'i don gyi 'grel pa zhes bya ba /
translated: The commentary on the profound meaning called the commentary on the glorious vajra garland of the great yoga tantra.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to glorious Vajrasattva.

original: gang zhig gtum mo'i rnal 'byor chags phyir bdud rtsi'i ro la nges brten pa //
analyzed: gang zhig gtum mo'i rnal 'byor chags phyir bdud rtsi'i ro la nges brten pa //
translated: He who, for the sake of the yoga of Caṇḍālī passion, certainly relies on the taste of nectar,

original: gang zhig ma la ya rtse'i logs las lus kyi nang na tshim byed cing //
analyzed: gang zhig ma la ya rtse'i logs las lus kyi nang na tshim byed cing //
translated: He who, from the side of the peak of Mt. Malaya, satisfies within the body,

original: gang zhig 'khor ba'i 'gro ba yongs su dag pa la ni thabs bstan mdzad //
analyzed: gang zhig 'khor ba'i 'gro ba yongs su dag pa la ni thabs bstan mdzad //
translated: He who teaches the means for the complete purification of beings in saṃsāra,

original: yum bcas rdo rje sems des khyed rnams la ni dge legs ster gyur cig / dpal ldan gsang ba 'dus nyid kyi //🔽rdo rje phreng ba zhes bya ba'i //
analyzed: yum bcas rdo rje sems des khyed rnams la ni dge legs ster gyur cig / dpal ldan gsang ba 'dus nyid kyi // rdo rje phreng ba zhes bya ba'i //
translated: May that Vajrasattva together with his consort bestow virtue and goodness upon you all.🔽The commentary called the stainless instructions

original: 'grel ba man ngag dri med ni //
analyzed: 'grel ba man ngag dri med ni //
translated: on the vajra garland🔽of the glorious Guhyasamāja

original: bshad pa'i rgyud la yang dag bshad //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud la yang dag bshad //
translated: is explained well in the explanatory tantras.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gi sprul pa'i sku dngos rgyal bu don thams cad grub pas chu bo nee ranydz'a na'i 'gram du phyin ci log gi ting nge 'dzin mkha' khyab ces bya ba la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gi sprul pa'i sku dngos rgyal bu don thams cad grub pas chu bo nee ranydz'a na'i 'gram du phyin ci log gi ting nge 'dzin mkha' khyab ces bya ba la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: Here, the actual nirmāṇakāya of Bhagavān Vajradhara, Prince Siddhārtha, went to the bank of the Nairañjanā River and entered the meditative absorption called “the pervading space of inverted samādhi.”

original: 'di nyid ni byang chub bo snyam du dgongs nas gnas par gyur to //🔽de nas mngon par dga' @2a # //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni byang chub bo snyam du dgongs nas gnas par gyur to // de nas mngon par dga' @2a # //
translated: Thinking, “This is enlightenment,” he remained there.

original: ba dang / 'og min dang / rin chen 'byung gnas dang / bde ba can dang / me tog ldan pa zhes bya ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams nas byon te /
analyzed: ba dang / 'og min dang / rin chen 'byung gnas dang / bde ba can dang / me tog ldan pa zhes bya ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams nas byon te /
translated: Then, from the buddha realms called Abhirati, Akaniṣṭha, Ratnākara, Sukhāvatī, and Puṣpāvatī,

original: rgyal bu don thams cad grub pa de nyid la /
analyzed: rgyal bu don thams cad grub pa de nyid la /
translated: they came to Prince Siddhārtha.

original: bsam gtan 'di ni rnam dag min //
analyzed: bsam gtan 'di ni rnam dag min //
translated: “This meditative concentration is impure.”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskul bas de nas phyin ci log gi bsam gtan de dor bar gyur to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskul bas de nas phyin ci log gi bsam gtan de dor bar gyur to //
translated: Thus, he was inspired with those words and so forth. Then, he abandoned that inverted meditative concentration.

original: de'i rjes su bar snang la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis yongs su gang bar rnam par gzigs nas ;
analyzed: de'i rjes su bar snang la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis yongs su gang bar rnam par gzigs nas ;
translated: After that, he saw the space completely filled with all tathāgatas.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya w'a ka tsitta pra na me na badzra bandha nam ka ro mi zhes bya ba phyag 'tshal ba dang bskor ba sngon du 'gro bas phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo'i ting nge 'dzin bstan pa'i
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya w'a ka tsitta pra na me na badzra bandha nam ka ro mi zhes bya ba phyag 'tshal ba dang bskor ba sngon du 'gro bas phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo'i ting nge 'dzin bstan pa'i
translated: Oṃ, I pay homage to the body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas, and I offer homage to the vajra bandha.

original: don du bcom ldan 'das de rnams nyid la gsol ba btab par gyur to //
analyzed: don du bcom ldan 'das de rnams nyid la gsol ba btab par gyur to //
translated: Having made prostrations and circumambulations, they supplicated the blessed ones to teach the samādhi of the essence of unerring suchness.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de rnams kyis phyag rgya chen po'i dkyil 'khor sprul pa sngon du 'gro bas slob ma sta gon la gnas pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / dbang bskur bzhi dang / dam tshig dang sdom pa sbyin pa sngon du 'gro bas rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa'i dbang bskur bzhi pa rnams kyis dbang bskur nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de rnams kyis phyag rgya chen po'i dkyil 'khor sprul pa sngon du 'gro bas slob ma sta gon la gnas pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / dbang bskur bzhi dang / dam tshig dang sdom pa sbyin pa sngon du 'gro bas rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa'i dbang bskur bzhi pa rnams kyis dbang bskur nas /
translated: Then, the blessed ones emanated the maṇḍala of the great mudra, and having placed the disciples in the setup, generated bodhicitta, conferred the four empowerments, and given the samayas and vows, they conferred the four empowerments with their subdivisions.

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum dang / rigs brgya rab tu dbye ba dang / rim pa lnga bstan pa'i rim pa man ngag nye bar @2b bstan nas /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum dang / rigs brgya rab tu dbye ba dang / rim pa lnga bstan pa'i rim pa man ngag nye bar @2b bstan nas /
translated: After the intimate instructions were taught,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams rang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du nye bar gshegs par gyur to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams rang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du nye bar gshegs par gyur to //
translated: those tathagatas each went to their own buddha realm.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya seng ge sngon bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bstan pa'i man ngag gi dbang po rnon po nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya seng ge sngon bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bstan pa'i man ngag gi dbang po rnon po nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Then, the bhagavat Shakyasimha, having actualized the sharp faculties of the intimate instructions taught by the previous bhagavats,

original: mngon du mdzad nas nam phyed na mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te tho rangs kyi dus su bdud bcom par mdzad nas dga' ldan gyi gnas su gshegs te /
analyzed: mngon du mdzad nas nam phyed na mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te tho rangs kyi dus su bdud bcom par mdzad nas dga' ldan gyi gnas su gshegs te /
translated: at midnight he became a perfect buddha and at dawn he conquered Mara and went to the abode of Tushita.

original: rang gi sku'i 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa rnams las rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i gzhal yas khang spros so //
analyzed: rang gi sku'i 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa rnams las rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i gzhal yas khang spros so //
translated: From his own great elements and so on, he emanated a celestial mansion made of the seven precious substances.

original: nyid kyi phung po lnga rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang / sa la sogs pa'i khams rnams las spyan ma la sogs pa lhan cig spyod ma bzhi dang / mig la sogs pa drug dang / yan lag gi tshogs thams cad dang / rgyus pa dang bcas pa thams cad las ji ltar srid par gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa lnga byang chub sems dpa' brgyad dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: nyid kyi phung po lnga rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang / sa la sogs pa'i khams rnams las spyan ma la sogs pa lhan cig spyod ma bzhi dang / mig la sogs pa drug dang / yan lag gi tshogs thams cad dang / rgyus pa dang bcas pa thams cad las ji ltar srid par gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa lnga byang chub sems dpa' brgyad dang bcas pa dang /
translated: From his five aggregates, the five transcendent ones; from the elements of earth and so forth, the four attendant goddesses Locanā and so forth; from the six sense faculties such as the eyes, the six male bodhisattvas; from all the collections of limbs and all the ligaments, the five goddesses such as Rūpavajrā and the eight male bodhisattvas;

original: rang gi sku'i yan lag dang nye ba'i yan lag bcas pa rnams las khro bo bcu spros par gyur to //
analyzed: rang gi sku'i yan lag dang nye ba'i yan lag bcas pa rnams las khro bo bcu spros par gyur to //
translated: and from all the major and minor parts of his body, the ten male wrathful ones emanated.

original: de'i rjes su de gtso bor gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo nam mkha'i ngos khyab pa'i bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba btab nas /
analyzed: de'i rjes su de gtso bor gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo nam mkha'i ngos khyab pa'i bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba btab nas /
translated: After that, he supplicated the Bhagavān, who was the principal one of the maṇḍala wheels pervading the realm of space.

original: 'dod chags can gyi 'dod chags spang ba'i don du chags pa dang bral pa'i dbye bas rigs rnam pa bzhi nye bar bstan nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags can gyi 'dod chags spang ba'i don du chags pa dang bral pa'i dbye bas rigs rnam pa bzhi nye bar bstan nas /
translated: In order to abandon the attachment of those with attachment, he taught the four families through the division of being free from attachment.

original: gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud chen po stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga pa bstan par gyur to //
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud chen po stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga pa bstan par gyur to //
translated: The great tantra of the Guhyasamaja, consisting of twenty-five thousand chapters, was taught.

original: de'i rjes su slar yang tshe dang lta ba dang nyon mongs pa dang skal ba dang sems can gyi snyigs mas khyab pa'i sems can gyi khams la gzigs te /
analyzed: de'i rjes su slar yang tshe dang lta ba dang nyon mongs pa dang skal ba dang sems can gyi snyigs mas khyab pa'i sems can gyi khams la gzigs te /
translated: After that, he looked again at the realm of sentient beings, pervaded by the degeneration of life, view, afflictions, fortune, and sentient beings.

original: dkyil 'khor pa de rnams la gsol ba btab pas nyung ngu'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba gzhung gi tshad brgya phrag bco brgyad pa le'u bco brgyad kyi bdag nyid can bstan par gyur to //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor pa de rnams la gsol ba btab pas nyung ngu'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba gzhung gi tshad brgya phrag bco brgyad pa le'u bco brgyad kyi bdag nyid can bstan par gyur to //
translated: By the request of those mandala members, the king of short tantras called the glorious Guhyasamaja, consisting of eighteen chapters with a length of one hundred and eight texts, was taught.

original: de yang sdud pa po phyag na rdo rje'am 'jam dpal gyis brgyud nas mi'i 'jig rten du 'ongs so //
analyzed: de yang sdud pa po phyag na rdo rje'am 'jam dpal gyis brgyud nas mi'i 'jig rten du 'ongs so //
translated: Moreover, it was compiled by Vajrapani or Manjushri and came to the human world through the lineage.

original: de la rdzogs ldan dang gsum ldan dang gnyis ldan dang rtsod pa can gyi dus su zhal gyi gdams ngag dang / rtsa ba'i rgyud dang / yan lag gi rgyud dang bshad pa'i rgyud la sogs pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni kha cig smra'o //🔽gzhan dag ni rtsod pa'i dus 'di nyid du sems can thams cad rjes su gzung ba'i @3a * //
analyzed: de la rdzogs ldan dang gsum ldan dang gnyis ldan dang rtsod pa can gyi dus su zhal gyi gdams ngag dang / rtsa ba'i rgyud dang / yan lag gi rgyud dang bshad pa'i rgyud la sogs pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni kha cig smra'o // gzhan dag ni rtsod pa'i dus 'di nyid du sems can thams cad rjes su gzung ba'i @3a * //
translated: Some say that the oral instructions, the root tantras, the branch tantras, the explanatory tantras, and so on were taught during the ages of completeness, three-fourths, two-fourths, and conflict.

original: phyir nyung ngu'i rtsa ba'i rgyud bstan pa'i de ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das kyis yan lag gi rgyud dang bshad pa'i rgyud la sogs pa bstan zhes zer ro //
analyzed: phyir nyung ngu'i rtsa ba'i rgyud bstan pa'i de ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das kyis yan lag gi rgyud dang bshad pa'i rgyud la sogs pa bstan zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the Blessed One taught the root tantras, the branch tantras, the explanatory tantras, and so on immediately after teaching the root tantras for the sake of guiding all sentient beings during this very age of conflict.

original: phyogs 'di yang 'ongs pa yin te /
analyzed: phyogs 'di yang 'ongs pa yin te /
translated: This position is also correct,

original: rtsod pa can gyi dus su shes rab dman pa nyid kyis sems can rnams la rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rnam par dbye ba bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pas gdon mi za bar nye bar mkho ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsod pa can gyi dus su shes rab dman pa nyid kyis sems can rnams la rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rnam par dbye ba bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pas gdon mi za bar nye bar mkho ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because during the age of conflict, the Blessed One taught the divisions of the root tantras for the sake of sentient beings, who have inferior intelligence, and because they are certainly necessary.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud bstan pa de yang 'dus par gyur pa ni cho ga lnga'i rgyud kyi sbyor ba bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud bstan pa de yang 'dus par gyur pa ni cho ga lnga'i rgyud kyi sbyor ba bsdus pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān’s teaching of the tantra is also a gathering, a collection of the tantras of the five rites.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: bya ba dang / spyod pa dang / rnal 'byor dang / rnal 'byor chen po dang / rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi dbye bas so //🔽de la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang chung zhing chung la /
analyzed: bya ba dang / spyod pa dang / rnal 'byor dang / rnal 'byor chen po dang / rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi dbye bas so // de la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang chung zhing chung la /
translated: the divisions of the tantras of action, conduct, yoga, great yoga, and yoginī.

original: gti mug che zhing che ba bram ze'i rigs su gyur pa'i sems can la brten nas /
analyzed: gti mug che zhing che ba bram ze'i rigs su gyur pa'i sems can la brten nas /
translated: There, based on sentient beings of the brahmin caste, whose desire and anger are small and small,

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i gnas su dpal sgron ma 'byung ba la sogs par bstan par khrus lan gsum byed pa dang / gos lan gsum brje ba dang / 'o ma dang thug pa za ba'i spyod pa gtso bor byed pa rnams la rigs pa'i dbang lnga po rnams gtso bor bstan pa mdzad do //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i gnas su dpal sgron ma 'byung ba la sogs par bstan par khrus lan gsum byed pa dang / gos lan gsum brje ba dang / 'o ma dang thug pa za ba'i spyod pa gtso bor byed pa rnams la rigs pa'i dbang lnga po rnams gtso bor bstan pa mdzad do //
translated: and whose ignorance is great and great, in the abode of the gods of the Thirty-Three, the glorious Lamp that Brings Revelation, and so on, were taught the three ablutions, the three changes of clothes, and the conduct of eating milk and porridge, and the five initiations were taught as primary.

original: de nas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag chung zhing gti mug shin tu chen por gyur pa khyab 'jug la mos pa /
analyzed: de nas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag chung zhing gti mug shin tu chen por gyur pa khyab 'jug la mos pa /
translated: Then, for those who have little attachment and aversion but have great ignorance, the Bhagavān taught the glorious Tantra of the Enlightenment of Vairocana to those who are devoted to Viṣṇu,

original: rje'u'i rigs kyi rigs can gyi sems can rnams la brten nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dpal rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa spyod pa'i rgyud bstan pas /
analyzed: rje'u'i rigs kyi rigs can gyi sems can rnams la brten nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dpal rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa spyod pa'i rgyud bstan pas /
translated: based on sentient beings of the vaiśya caste.

original: bsnyen gnas dang 'dra ba'i thun mong ba bcu gnyis nas nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i bar du smyung ba dang khrus la sogs pa'i spyod pa gtso bor ston par byed pa sngon gyi rang dang 'dra bar dbang bskur ston par byed pa /
analyzed: bsnyen gnas dang 'dra ba'i thun mong ba bcu gnyis nas nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i bar du smyung ba dang khrus la sogs pa'i spyod pa gtso bor ston par byed pa sngon gyi rang dang 'dra bar dbang bskur ston par byed pa /
translated: It teaches the conduct of fasting and bathing, and so on, for twelve to twenty-four days, which is similar to the one-day vow. It teaches the empowerment that is similar to one’s own former [empowerment].

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa gcig pu tsam ston par byed pa ni 'og min gyi gnas su mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa gcig pu tsam ston par byed pa ni 'og min gyi gnas su mdzad pa'o //
translated: It teaches only the creation stage, and it was performed in the Akaniṣṭha realm.

original: de'i rjes su gti mug 'bring dang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang 'bring gi sems can rnams la brten nas /
analyzed: de'i rjes su gti mug 'bring dang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang 'bring gi sems can rnams la brten nas /
translated: After that, for those sentient beings who have medium ignorance and medium attachment and aversion,

original: rgyal rigs kyi rigs can gdul ba'i don du rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i gzugs thob nas ri rab kyi rtse mor sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis seng ge'i khrir gyur pa la dam pa tog dkar po'i gnas skabs kyi lus kyis bzhugs nas /
analyzed: rgyal rigs kyi rigs can gdul ba'i don du rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i gzugs thob nas ri rab kyi rtse mor sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis seng ge'i khrir gyur pa la dam pa tog dkar po'i gnas skabs kyi lus kyis bzhugs nas /
translated: For the sake of taming those of the kṣatriya class, he attained the form of Great Vairocana and, by the power of his previous aspirations, sat on a lion throne on the peak of Mount Meru.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sang dang gti mug dang ser snas gnon pa'i dbang po dang / dbang phyug chen @3b po dang / ma skyes pa dang / ae la bi la gdul ba'i phyir rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rdo rje dbyings dang / khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sang dang gti mug dang ser snas gnon pa'i dbang po dang / dbang phyug chen @3b po dang / ma skyes pa dang / ae la bi la gdul ba'i phyir rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rdo rje dbyings dang / khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba dang /
translated: In the body of the stage of the sublime Sattva, he sat in order to tame those who were oppressed by desire, anger, ignorance, and miserliness, such as Īśvara, Maheśvara, Ajita, and Elapattra.🔽In order to tame those beings, he taught the four realizations, which are the nature of the four maṇḍalas called the maṇḍala of the vajra realm, the maṇḍala of the total victory over the three realms,

original: 'gro ba 'dul ba dang / don thams cad grub pa'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba rtogs pa rnam pa bzhi'i bdag nyid can rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal de kho na nyid 'dus pa zhes bya ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba dang / don thams cad grub pa'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba rtogs pa rnam pa bzhi'i bdag nyid can rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal de kho na nyid 'dus pa zhes bya ba bstan pa ni /
translated: the maṇḍala of the taming of migrating beings, and the maṇḍala of the accomplishment of all aims. He taught the king of tantras called the glorious Compendium of Principles.

original: gtso bor rdo rje slob dpon gyi dbang bskur ma lus pa ston pa bskyed pa'i rim pa'i steng du thig le'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa dang bcas pa mdzad do //
analyzed: gtso bor rdo rje slob dpon gyi dbang bskur ma lus pa ston pa bskyed pa'i rim pa'i steng du thig le'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa dang bcas pa mdzad do //
translated: He taught the entire initiation of the vajra master, and on the basis of the creation stage, he taught the yoga of the drops.

original: de'i rjes su de nyid du dpal rdo rje rtse mo'i rgyud bstan par mdzad do //
analyzed: de'i rjes su de nyid du dpal rdo rje rtse mo'i rgyud bstan par mdzad do //
translated: After that, he taught the Vajraśekhara Tantra in that very place.

original: de'i rjes su dga' byed sh'akya thub pa'i gzugs kyis lha'i bu nor bu'i 'od gdul ba'i don du ngan song thams cad sbyong ba'i rgyud bstan par mdzad do //
analyzed: de'i rjes su dga' byed sh'akya thub pa'i gzugs kyis lha'i bu nor bu'i 'od gdul ba'i don du ngan song thams cad sbyong ba'i rgyud bstan par mdzad do //
translated: After that, in the form of Śākyamuni, he taught the Tantra of Purifying All Destinies in order to tame the devaputra Maṇiprabha.

original: de nas ri rab kyi steng du sgo glegs kyi gtsug lag khang gi nang du phyag na rdo rje'i gzugs kyis gsang ba'i bdag po phyag na rdo rje gdul ba'i don du phyag na rdo rje dbang bskur ba'i rgyud bstan par mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas ri rab kyi steng du sgo glegs kyi gtsug lag khang gi nang du phyag na rdo rje'i gzugs kyis gsang ba'i bdag po phyag na rdo rje gdul ba'i don du phyag na rdo rje dbang bskur ba'i rgyud bstan par mdzad do //
translated: Then, in the form of Vajrapāṇi, he taught the Vajrapāṇyabhiṣeka Tantra in order to tame the lord of guhyakas, Vajrapāṇi, in the inner sanctum of the door-guarded temple on top of Mount Meru.

original: de nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed du rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs kyis bdud 'dul ba'i phyir dpal mchog chen po'i rgyud bstan par mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed du rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs kyis bdud 'dul ba'i phyir dpal mchog chen po'i rgyud bstan par mdzad do //
translated: Then, in the Heaven of Controlling Others' Emanations, in the form of Vajrasattva, in order to subdue Mara, he taught the Tantra of the Great Supreme Glory.

original: de'i rjes su 'dod chags dang zhe sdang che zhing /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'dod chags dang zhe sdang che zhing /
translated: After that, in order to subdue the sentient beings of the Kshatriya caste, who have great desire and anger,

original: gti mug chung ba'i rje'i rigs kyi sems can rnams la brten nas dga' ldan gyi lha rnams la gtso bor dbang bzhi ston pa /
analyzed: gti mug chung ba'i rje'i rigs kyi sems can rnams la brten nas dga' ldan gyi lha rnams la gtso bor dbang bzhi ston pa /
translated: but little ignorance, in the Heaven of Joy, he taught the Guhyasamaja Tantra, which is primarily about the four empowerments,

original: rim pa gnyis kyis bsdus pa dang / gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud bstan par mdzad do //
analyzed: rim pa gnyis kyis bsdus pa dang / gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud bstan par mdzad do //
translated: and which is contained within the two stages.

original: de'i rjes su au rgyan du nub kyi ri la bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs kyis khro bo bcu'i sgo nas gtso bor phyogs skyong bcu 'dul ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rjes su au rgyan du nub kyi ri la bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs kyis khro bo bcu'i sgo nas gtso bor phyogs skyong bcu 'dul ba'i phyir /
translated: After that, in Oddiyana, on the western mountain, in the form of the glorious Vajrasattva, in order to primarily subdue the ten direction protectors through the ten wrathful ones,

original: rdo rje phreng ba stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dang rdo rje phreng ba nyung ngu'i rgyud gnyis bstan par mdzad do //
analyzed: rdo rje phreng ba stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dang rdo rje phreng ba nyung ngu'i rgyud gnyis bstan par mdzad do //
translated: he taught the Twelve Thousand Vajra Garland Tantra and the Concise Vajra Garland Tantra.

original: de'i rjes su de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol ba 'debs pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyis dpal ldan rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs kyis kha ba can gyi ri la mi rnams kyi nang du dpal dgongs pa lung bstan gyi rgyud bstan par mdzad do //
analyzed: de'i rjes su de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol ba 'debs pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyis dpal ldan rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs kyis kha ba can gyi ri la mi rnams kyi nang du dpal dgongs pa lung bstan gyi rgyud bstan par mdzad do //
translated: After that, the Bhagavān, requested by the Tathāgata, taught the glorious Tantra of the Prophecies of Intention in the land of snow mountains in the form of the glorious Vajrasattva.

original: de'i rjes su lha mo bzhis gsol ba btab pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyis ri bo 'bigs byed kyi rtse mo la dpal lha mo bzhis zhus kyi rgyud bstan par mdzad do //
analyzed: de'i rjes su lha mo bzhis gsol ba btab pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyis ri bo 'bigs byed kyi rtse mo la dpal lha mo bzhis zhus kyi rgyud bstan par mdzad do //
translated: After that, the Bhagavān, requested by the four goddesses, taught the Tantra Requested by the Four Goddesses on the peak of the Vindhya mountain.

original: de'i rjes su gang+g'a'i 'gram du dpal ye shes rdo rje kun las btus pa'i rgyud chen po dang chung ngu'i dbye bas bstan par mdzad @4a * //
analyzed: de'i rjes su gang+g'a'i 'gram du dpal ye shes rdo rje kun las btus pa'i rgyud chen po dang chung ngu'i dbye bas bstan par mdzad @4a * //
translated: After that, on the banks of the Ganges, he taught the glorious Tantra of the Compendium of Vajra Wisdom, which is divided into a great and a small tantra.

original: do // de'i rjes su 'dod chags dang zhe sdang chen po'i chen po gti mug chung zhing chung ba'i gdol ba'i rigs dang 'brel ba'i sems can rnams la brten nas /
analyzed: do // de'i rjes su 'dod chags dang zhe sdang chen po'i chen po gti mug chung zhing chung ba'i gdol ba'i rigs dang 'brel ba'i sems can rnams la brten nas /
translated: After that, he taught the tantras of the great and small Vajra of Delight, which are related to the low-caste beings who have great desire and hatred, and who have little ignorance.

original: bcom ldan 'das dpal 'khor lo bde ba mchog chen po dang chung ngu'i rgyud kyi dbye bas rim pa gnyis gtso bor ston pa dang / gtso bor dbang bzhi ston pa dang / shes rab gtso bor gyur pa'i bshad pa'i rgyud bzhi dang bcas pa gnas gtsang ma 'phags pa'i gnas su bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dpal 'khor lo bde ba mchog chen po dang chung ngu'i rgyud kyi dbye bas rim pa gnyis gtso bor ston pa dang / gtso bor dbang bzhi ston pa dang / shes rab gtso bor gyur pa'i bshad pa'i rgyud bzhi dang bcas pa gnas gtsang ma 'phags pa'i gnas su bstan par mdzad de /
translated: The Bhagavān taught the great and small tantras of the glorious Cakrasaṃvara, which are divided into the two stages, primarily the stage of generation and the stage of completion, and the four explanatory tantras, which primarily teach the four empowerments, in the pure abode of the gods.

original: rgyud bzhi po'i gnas kyi rnam par dbye ba 'dir mi dgos pa'i phyir ma bstan to //
analyzed: rgyud bzhi po'i gnas kyi rnam par dbye ba 'dir mi dgos pa'i phyir ma bstan to //
translated: The divisions of the abodes of the four tantras are not necessary here and therefore are not taught.

original: de'i rjes su 'dzam bu'i gling 'di nyid du ma ga dh'ar bdud bzhi 'dul ba'i don du dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i rgyud bstan pa chen po dang chung ngu'i rgyud bshad pa'i rgyud dang bcas pa bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'dzam bu'i gling 'di nyid du ma ga dh'ar bdud bzhi 'dul ba'i don du dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i rgyud bstan pa chen po dang chung ngu'i rgyud bshad pa'i rgyud dang bcas pa bstan par mdzad de /
translated: After that, in Magadha in this world, in order to subdue the four māras, he taught the great and small tantras of Śrī Heruka and the explanatory tantras in the great teaching of the tantra.

original: de'i yang gnas kyi rnam par dbye ba la sogs pa mi dgos pa'i phyir 'dir ma bstan to //
analyzed: de'i yang gnas kyi rnam par dbye ba la sogs pa mi dgos pa'i phyir 'dir ma bstan to //
translated: The divisions of the abodes of those tantras and so on are not necessary here and therefore are not taught.

original: de'i phyir 'dir rgyud sde lnga'i nang nas bcom ldan 'das thugs rje chen po dang ldan pas au rgyan du nub kyi ri la rdo rje phreng ba'i rgyud chung du bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir rgyud sde lnga'i nang nas bcom ldan 'das thugs rje chen po dang ldan pas au rgyan du nub kyi ri la rdo rje phreng ba'i rgyud chung du bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Therefore, here, the Bhagavān endowed with great compassion, in the five tantras, taught the Vajra Garland Tantra in Uḍḍiyāna in the western mountains.

original: le'u drug cu rtsa brgyad kyi bdag nyid can 'dri ba dang lan brgyad cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can bstan par mdzad do //
analyzed: le'u drug cu rtsa brgyad kyi bdag nyid can 'dri ba dang lan brgyad cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can bstan par mdzad do //
translated: He taught it in sixty-eight chapters and eighty-two questions and answers.

original: 'di yang brjod par bya ba'i rim pa gnyis ni gtso bo'i don to //
analyzed: 'di yang brjod par bya ba'i rim pa gnyis ni gtso bo'i don to //
translated: This also has two topics to be expressed, which are the main topics.

original: de la dang po rdo rje phreng ba'i rgyud sdud pa po phyag na rdo rje'am 'jam dpal rgyud kyi don ma lus pa thugs la nye bar bzhag nas ngag dang po gleng gzhi ngag gi rnam grangs gzhan dang ldan pa 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pa
analyzed: de la dang po rdo rje phreng ba'i rgyud sdud pa po phyag na rdo rje'am 'jam dpal rgyud kyi don ma lus pa thugs la nye bar bzhag nas ngag dang po gleng gzhi ngag gi rnam grangs gzhan dang ldan pa 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pa
translated: First, the compiler of the Vajra Garland Tantra, Vajrapāṇi or Mañjuśrī, having placed the entire meaning of the tantra in his mind, spoke the first chapter, which has other synonyms of the introduction, beginning with “Thus have I heard.”

original: gsungs so // 'di la don gsum ste /
analyzed: gsungs so // 'di la don gsum ste /
translated: Here there are three topics.

original: gleng gzhi'i ngag gi dgos pa dang / gleng gzhi'i bsdus pa'i don dang de nyid kyi yan lag gi don to //
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i ngag gi dgos pa dang / gleng gzhi'i bsdus pa'i don dang de nyid kyi yan lag gi don to //
translated: The purpose of the nidāna statement, the summarized meaning of the nidāna, and the subsidiary meaning of that.

original: de la dang po nyan pa po'i skye bo la dbugs dbyung ba bskyed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' yongs su bskyang ba dang / yid ches pa'i gdams ngag thob pas bdag nyid khyad par du 'phags pa'i nyan pa por ston pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la dang po nyan pa po'i skye bo la dbugs dbyung ba bskyed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' yongs su bskyang ba dang / yid ches pa'i gdams ngag thob pas bdag nyid khyad par du 'phags pa'i nyan pa por ston pa nyid do //
translated: Therein, first, it generates inspiration in the audience, it protects the speech of the Blessed One, and it shows that the teacher himself is a special listener by obtaining an authoritative instruction.

original: bsdus don zhes bya ba ni phun sum tshogs pa lnga dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: bsdus don zhes bya ba ni phun sum tshogs pa lnga dang ldan pa ste /
translated: What is called summarized meaning is endowed with five perfections:

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa'i bya ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa'i bya ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Therein, Thus have I heard and so on show the perfection of the teaching.

original: bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'khor phun sum tshogs pa mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'khor phun sum tshogs pa mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: By I have heard and so on, the perfection of the retinue is briefly indicated.

original: dus gcig na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni @4b dus phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni @4b dus phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: By at one time and so on, the perfection of time is shown.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ston pa po phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ston pa po phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: By the Blessed One and so on, the perfection of the teacher is shown.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi snying po rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga rnams la bzhugs te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi snying po rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga rnams la bzhugs te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The phrase abiding in the bhaga of the Vajra Queen, the essence of the body, speech, and mind of all Tathagatas and so forth teaches the perfection of place.

original: de la yan lag gi don rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la yan lag gi don rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, there are two topics:

original: dang po ni bshad pa rnam pa bzhi dang / gnyis pa ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid kyis bshad pa'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: dang po ni bshad pa rnam pa bzhi dang / gnyis pa ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid kyis bshad pa'i dbye ba'o //
translated: the first is the four kinds of explanation, and the second is the division of the explanation by outer and inner natures.

original: de la yi ge'i don bshad pa'i skabs su phun sum tshogs pa rnams pa lngas bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la yi ge'i don bshad pa'i skabs su phun sum tshogs pa rnams pa lngas bshad par bya ste /
translated: In the context of explaining the meaning of the syllables, it should be explained by the five perfections.

original: de bzhin nyid dang / zla ba dang / sa bon dang / lus kyi dbye bas bcom ldan 'das rdzogs pa'i ji skad du gsungs pa'i gzhal yas khang gi nang du bzhugs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / zla ba dang / sa bon dang / lus kyi dbye bas bcom ldan 'das rdzogs pa'i ji skad du gsungs pa'i gzhal yas khang gi nang du bzhugs pa ni /
translated: The Bhagavān, who is complete in the way described, abides in the celestial mansion as taught, by way of the suchness, moon, seed, and body divisions.

original: mtha' drug gi bshad pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya zhing rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mtha' drug gi bshad pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya zhing rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood and realized by following the explanation of the six parameters.

original: de'i rjes su 'di dag gi zhe'am /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'di dag gi zhe'am /
translated: After that, it says these or this.

original: 'di dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa mi zad pa yongs su spangs nas 'di skad ces bya ba'i yi ge gnyis la brgya byin gyis zhus pa'i mdo'i khungs kyis ae bam gi tshig / kun gyi gzhi dang pha ma ni //
analyzed: 'di dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa mi zad pa yongs su spangs nas 'di skad ces bya ba'i yi ge gnyis la brgya byin gyis zhus pa'i mdo'i khungs kyis ae bam gi tshig / kun gyi gzhi dang pha ma ni //
translated: The basis of all and the father and mother

original: yi ge gnyis dang de bzhin bstan //
analyzed: yi ge gnyis dang de bzhin bstan //
translated: are taught as the two syllables.

original: yi ge ae ni mar gyur la /
analyzed: yi ge ae ni mar gyur la /
translated: The syllable “e” is the mother,

original: bam ni pha zhes bya bar grags //
analyzed: bam ni pha zhes bya bar grags //
translated: and “vaṃ” is known as the father.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pas brjod nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pas brjod nas /
translated: Having explained with such statements,

original: de'i rjes la bdag gis thos pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i rjes la bdag gis thos pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: after that, he said, “I heard.”

original: sa bon ngo bos gang sprul ba //
analyzed: sa bon ngo bos gang sprul ba //
translated: The seed that is emanated by nature

original: lha rnams kyis ni 'khor lo mchog //
analyzed: lha rnams kyis ni 'khor lo mchog //
translated: is the supreme wheel of the gods.

original: mchog tu dga' ba'i dus gang yin //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i dus gang yin //
translated: The time of supreme joy

original: dus gcig na zhes bshad pa yin //
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes bshad pa yin //
translated: is explained as “at one time.”

original: dbang phyug brgyad kyi bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: dbang phyug brgyad kyi bcom ldan 'das //
translated: The Bhagavān with the eight lordly qualities

original: bde ba chen po'i gnas la bzhugs //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i gnas la bzhugs //
translated: resides in the place of great bliss.

original: 'di yi phung po lnga rgyal ba //
analyzed: 'di yi phung po lnga rgyal ba //
translated: His five aggregates are victorious,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yin //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yin //
translated: and he is all the tathāgatas.

original: de yi bdag nyid sku gsung thugs //
analyzed: de yi bdag nyid sku gsung thugs //
translated: His body, speech, and mind are of that nature.

original: rdo rje snying 'dir bde chen po //
analyzed: rdo rje snying 'dir bde chen po //
translated: The vajra heart is great bliss.

original: btsun mo legs sbyangs phyag rgya che //
analyzed: btsun mo legs sbyangs phyag rgya che //
translated: The queen is the perfected great seal.

original: legs sbyangs padma bha ga yin //
analyzed: legs sbyangs padma bha ga yin //
translated: The perfected lotus is the bhaga.

original: bzhugs pa rdo rje 'dzin pa der //
analyzed: bzhugs pa rdo rje 'dzin pa der //
translated: The abode is the vajra holder.

original: thig le'i gzugs kyis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: thig le'i gzugs kyis gnas pa'o //
translated: It abides in the form of a drop.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i spyi'i don gyi bshad pas don bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i spyi'i don gyi bshad pas don bstan to //
translated: Thus, the general meaning is explained, and the meaning is taught.

original: sbas pa'i don ni le'u lnga bcu rtsa dgu pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas /🔽ae ni shes rab dam pa ste //
analyzed: sbas pa'i don ni le'u lnga bcu rtsa dgu pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas / ae ni shes rab dam pa ste //
translated: The hidden meaning is set forth by following the fifty-ninth chapter,🔽beginning with “E is the sublime wisdom” and so forth.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bkod pa 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //🔽mthar thug pa'i don ni dgongs @5a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bkod pa 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro // mthar thug pa'i don ni dgongs @5a * //
translated: This will be explained below.🔽The ultimate meaning is explained by following the Tantra of the

original: pa lung bstan gyi rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas /
analyzed: pa lung bstan gyi rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas /
translated: Prediction of Intention,

original: rgyud ni bdag gis 'di skad thos //
analyzed: rgyud ni bdag gis 'di skad thos //
translated: beginning with “The tantra was heard by me in this way.

original: gsal ba 'ga' zhig dus yin te //
analyzed: gsal ba 'ga' zhig dus yin te //
translated: Some clarity is the time.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad do //
translated: ” Thus, and so forth.

original: 'dir yang rgyud 'di phal cher thun mong gi rgyud kyi bshad par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir rnal 'byor chen po dang / rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas gleng gzhi bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang rgyud 'di phal cher thun mong gi rgyud kyi bshad par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir rnal 'byor chen po dang / rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas gleng gzhi bshad par bya ste /
translated: Here, since this tantra is mostly an explanation of the common tantras, the nidana should be explained following the great yoga and yoga tantras.

original: de la re zhig phyi rol gyi bshad pa'i phyogs su 'di skad ces bya bas rgyud ma lus pa'i don ston par byed pa'i tshig gi phrad kyis sdud pa po'i brjod par 'dod pa la snang brgyud kyi don bsdu ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de la re zhig phyi rol gyi bshad pa'i phyogs su 'di skad ces bya bas rgyud ma lus pa'i don ston par byed pa'i tshig gi phrad kyis sdud pa po'i brjod par 'dod pa la snang brgyud kyi don bsdu ba gsungs so //
translated: In the external explanation, the words “thus have I heard” are stated by the compiler to summarize the meaning of the entire tantra, which is the appearance of the meaning of the tantra.

original: de ltar na 'di skad ces bya ba ni ji ltar sdud par gyur ba de lta bu nyid du ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di skad ces bya ba ni ji ltar sdud par gyur ba de lta bu nyid du ste /
translated: Thus, “thus have I heard” is just as it was compiled,

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa dag gis ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa dag gis ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but not by superimposition or denial.

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid gtso bor gyur pa'i 'khor de bzhin gshegs pa dang / lhan cig spyod ma dang / rjes su spyod ma dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang // khro bo'i gzugs kyis so //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid gtso bor gyur pa'i 'khor de bzhin gshegs pa dang / lhan cig spyod ma dang / rjes su spyod ma dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang // khro bo'i gzugs kyis so //
translated: The phrase I have heard refers to the retinue of which the self is the principal figure, together with the Tathagata, the female consorts who enjoy the same pleasures, the female consorts who enjoy the same activities, the bodhisattvas, and the wrathful forms.

original: de ltar ji ltar 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ba de'i phyir bdag nyid gtso bor gyur pa'i 'khor gyis so //
analyzed: de ltar ji ltar 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ba de'i phyir bdag nyid gtso bor gyur pa'i 'khor gyis so //
translated: Thus, as will be explained below, the retinue of which the self is the principal figure.

original: thos pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thos pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Heard means understood, not listened to.

original: rang nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i chos bstan pa yin gyi ston pa po las thos pa sdud pa pos sdud par byed de /
analyzed: rang nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i chos bstan pa yin gyi ston pa po las thos pa sdud pa pos sdud par byed de /
translated: The teaching of the Dharma of self-realized, perfect buddhahood is compiled by the compiler, who heard it from the teacher.

original: de bas na thos pa zhes bya ba 'dis 'og nas sdud pa po mtshon par byed do //
analyzed: de bas na thos pa zhes bya ba 'dis 'og nas sdud pa po mtshon par byed do //
translated: Therefore, the word heard indicates the compiler below.

original: dngos su ma yin pa thos pa'am gzhan du thos pa la sdud pa po tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos su ma yin pa thos pa'am gzhan du thos pa la sdud pa po tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not direct, or if it were heard from another, the compiler would not be authoritative.

original: de'i phyir bdag gis dngos su thos pa zhes brjod pa la bdag gi bla ma dang de'i bla ma rnams las ni ma yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gis dngos su thos pa zhes brjod pa la bdag gi bla ma dang de'i bla ma rnams las ni ma yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is said that “I directly heard” this, but not from my guru or his gurus.

original: gang gi zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi zhe na /
translated: From whom?

original: de'i phyir dus gcig na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dus gcig na zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it says “at one time.”

original: dus gcig ni dus gcig gi tshe na 'di thos la gzhan du ni gzhan dag thos pa'o zhes bya ba 'di sdud pa po mang du thos pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: dus gcig ni dus gcig gi tshe na 'di thos la gzhan du ni gzhan dag thos pa'o zhes bya ba 'di sdud pa po mang du thos pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: At one time means that this was heard at one time, and at another time something else was heard. This shows that the compiler was very learned.

original: yang dus gcig gi tshe zhes bya ba ni dus gcig la ste dus gzhan du 'di lta bu bstan pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dus gcig gi tshe zhes bya ba ni dus gcig la ste dus gzhan du 'di lta bu bstan pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Again, at one time means at one time, because at another time such a teaching did not exist.

original: des na rgyud rnyed par dka' ba nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: des na rgyud rnyed par dka' ba nyid gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it says that the continuum is difficult to obtain.

original: yang na dus gcig gi tshe 'di thos pa ste /
analyzed: yang na dus gcig gi tshe 'di thos pa ste /
translated: Or, at one time this was heard.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi padma las rgyud bstan pa'i ngag thos pa de nyid kyi tshe skad cig gcig nyid la bdag gis lhag chad med par @5b bzung zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi padma las rgyud bstan pa'i ngag thos pa de nyid kyi tshe skad cig gcig nyid la bdag gis lhag chad med par @5b bzung zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At the very moment when he heard the words of the tantra coming from the lotus face of the Lord, he retained them without omission or addition.

original: 'dis ni spobs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa nyid sdud pa po la bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni spobs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa nyid sdud pa po la bstan to //
translated: This shows that the compiler was endowed with perfect eloquence.

original: su las thos she na /
analyzed: su las thos she na /
translated: From whom did he hear it?

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he says, from the Lord.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das gnas khyad par can du bzhugs pa /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das gnas khyad par can du bzhugs pa /
translated: When the Lord was dwelling in a special place,

original: de'i tshe drung nas thos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i tshe drung nas thos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: then he heard it from his presence, is what it means.

original: de la bdud bzhi bcom pa'am dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan drug dang ldan pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de la bdud bzhi bcom pa'am dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan drug dang ldan pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: There, he is the Lord because he has conquered the four demons or because he is endowed with the six qualities of sovereignty, etc.

original: de stong pa nyid bsgoms pas 'chi bdag gi bdud bcom mo //
analyzed: de stong pa nyid bsgoms pas 'chi bdag gi bdud bcom mo //
translated: By meditating on emptiness, he conquered the demon of death.

original: lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can gyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam pa rang gi lus la yongs su shes pas phung po'i bdud bcom mo //
analyzed: lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can gyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam pa rang gi lus la yongs su shes pas phung po'i bdud bcom mo //
translated: By fully understanding the mandala circle in the form of the thirty-two deities in one's own body, one conquers the demon of the aggregates.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rnam pas nyon mongs pa lnga yongs su shes pas nyon mongs pa'i bdud bcom mo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rnam pas nyon mongs pa lnga yongs su shes pas nyon mongs pa'i bdud bcom mo //
translated: By fully understanding the five afflictions in the form of the five Tathagatas, one conquers the demon of the afflictions.

original: bgegs bskrad pa'i dus na dbang po la sogs pa'i phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten skyong ba la phur bus btab pas rnam par bcom pa'i phyir lha'i bu'i bdud bcom mo //
analyzed: bgegs bskrad pa'i dus na dbang po la sogs pa'i phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten skyong ba la phur bus btab pas rnam par bcom pa'i phyir lha'i bu'i bdud bcom mo //
translated: At the time of expelling the obstructors, by nailing down the guardians of the world in the ten directions such as Indra with the kīla, one conquers the demon of the sons of the gods.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das la dbang phyug tshang ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das la dbang phyug tshang ba ste /
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān is also complete with power

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has abandoned all afflictive and knowledge obscurations together with their imprints.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das la ye shes kyang tshang ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das la ye shes kyang tshang ba ste /
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān is also complete with wisdom

original: bdag med pa nyid kyi rnam pas chos thams cad yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid kyi rnam pas chos thams cad yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he fully understands all phenomena in the aspect of selflessness.

original: grags pa tshang pa ste /
analyzed: grags pa tshang pa ste /
translated: The complete glory,

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sgo nas thams cad du grags pa'i sgra rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sgo nas thams cad du grags pa'i sgra rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has attained the fame of being known everywhere by means of the recollection of the Buddha.

original: dpal tshang ba ste rnam pa thams cad du sems can thams cad kyi don du gnyer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpal tshang ba ste rnam pa thams cad du sems can thams cad kyi don du gnyer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The complete splendor, because he is intent on the welfare of all sentient beings in every way.

original: gzugs tshang ba ste mtshungs pa med pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad rnams kyis yan lag rnam par mdzes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs tshang ba ste mtshungs pa med pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad rnams kyis yan lag rnam par mdzes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The complete form, because his limbs are beautifully adorned with the major and minor marks that are unequaled.

original: 'bad pa tshang ba ste sems can gcig gi ched du yang 'khor ba'i mthar thug pa med par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bad pa tshang ba ste sems can gcig gi ched du yang 'khor ba'i mthar thug pa med par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The complete effort, because he remains in cyclic existence without limit for the sake of a single sentient being.

original: gnas gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gnas gang du zhe na /
translated: In what place?

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “the Blessed One, the abode of all tathāgatas,” and so on.

original: de bzhin nyid du gshegs pa dang / 'khor ba las ji ltar gshegs par bde pa de lta bu nyid du mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid du gshegs pa dang / dngos po 'ga' zhig ji ltar song ba de lta bu nyid du 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du gshegs pa dang / 'khor ba las ji ltar gshegs par bde pa de lta bu nyid du mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid du gshegs pa dang / dngos po 'ga' zhig ji ltar song ba de lta bu nyid du 'gyur bas na /
translated: The Thus-Gone One is so called because he has gone to suchness and to the transcendence of sorrow that is not located anywhere, just as he has gone to cyclic existence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: The Thus-Gone Ones are so called because they have gone to some entity, just as they have gone to suchness and to the transcendence of sorrow that is not located anywhere.

original: nam mkha'i gtos @6a * //
analyzed: nam mkha'i gtos @6a * //
translated: The all-pervading space🔽is all-pervading because it pervades all space.

original: thams cad khyab par byed pas na thams cad do //
analyzed: thams cad khyab par byed pas na thams cad do //
translated: It is all-pervading because it pervades all space.🔽The all-pervading Thus-Gone One is so called because he pervades all of the three realms.🔽The all-pervading Thus-Gone One is so called because he pervades all of the three realms.

original: thams cad kyang yin la de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de /🔽bsdu na rigs lnga dang 'brel ba rnams so //
analyzed: thams cad kyang yin la de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de / bsdu na rigs lnga dang 'brel ba rnams so //
translated: The all-pervading Thus-Gone One is so called because he pervades all of the three realms.🔽The all-pervading Thus-Gone One is so called because he pervades all of the three realms.🔽The all-pervading Thus-Gone One is so called because he pervades all of the three realms.🔽The all-pervading Thus-Gone One is so called because he pervades all of the three realms.🔽The all-pervading Thus-Gone One is so called because he pervades all of the three realms.🔽The all-pervading Thus-Gone One is so called because he pervades all of the three realms.🔽The all-pervading Thus-Gone One is so called because he pervades all of the three realms.🔽The all-pervading Thus-Gone One is so called because he pervades all of the three realms.🔽The all-pervading Thus-Gone One is so called because he pervades all of the three realms.🔽The all-pervading Thus-Gone One is so called because he pervades all of the three realms.🔽The all-pervading Thus-Gone One is so called because he pervades all of the three realms.

original: de rnams kyi sku gsung thugs ni rin chen 'byung ldan dang / don yod grub pa dag ji ltar rigs par rnam par snang mdzad dang snang ba mtha' yas dag la 'dus pa'i phyir gsang ba gsum gyi rang bzhin rnams te thams cad 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sku gsung thugs ni rin chen 'byung ldan dang / don yod grub pa dag ji ltar rigs par rnam par snang mdzad dang snang ba mtha' yas dag la 'dus pa'i phyir gsang ba gsum gyi rang bzhin rnams te thams cad 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The all-pervading Thus-Gone One is so called because he pervades all of the three realms.

original: de rnams kyi snying po'i ngo bo rdo rje btsun mo rnams ni spyan ma la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi snying po'i ngo bo rdo rje btsun mo rnams ni spyan ma la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The nature of the essence of those is the Vajra Queens, Lochana and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi bha ga ni chos 'byung gi phyag rgya'i rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bha ga ni chos 'byung gi phyag rgya'i rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: Their bhaga is the nature of the Dharma-source seal.

original: de la bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni de la gnas pa'i gzhal yas khang na bzhugs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni de la gnas pa'i gzhal yas khang na bzhugs par gyur pa'o //
translated: Abiding in that means abiding in the celestial mansion that is located there.

original: 'di skad ston par 'gyur te stong pa nyid bsgoms pa'i rjes la rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'i chos 'byung gi phyag rgya'i steng du yam ram bam lam gi sa bon yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa don yod grub pa ngag
analyzed: 'di skad ston par 'gyur te stong pa nyid bsgoms pa'i rjes la rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'i chos 'byung gi phyag rgya'i steng du yam ram bam lam gi sa bon yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa don yod grub pa ngag
translated: This is what is being taught: After meditating on emptiness, from the complete transformation of Great Vajradhara, on top of the Dharma-source seal, the seed syllables yam, ram, vam, and lam arise, and from the complete transformation of those seed syllables, Amoghasiddhi, Ratnasambhava, Amitabha, and Akshobhya arise.

original: gi dbang phyug dang thugs kyi dbang phyug dang rin chen 'byung ldan rig ma dang bcas pa yongs su gyur pa las rlung dang me dang chu dang sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du rnam par snang mdzad yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'i gzhal yas khang gi steng
analyzed: gi dbang phyug dang thugs kyi dbang phyug dang rin chen 'byung ldan rig ma dang bcas pa yongs su gyur pa las rlung dang me dang chu dang sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du rnam par snang mdzad yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'i gzhal yas khang gi steng
translated: and the lord of mind, and Ratnasaṃbhava with his knowledge consort, and from their complete transformation, upon the maṇḍalas of wind, fire, water, and earth, upon the celestial mansion arisen from the complete transformation of Vairocana,

original: du nyi ma dang zla ba la sogs pa'i gdan gi  steng du gang gi tshe ba bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa de'i tshe bdag gis thos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: du nyi ma dang zla ba la sogs pa'i gdan gi  steng du gang gi tshe ba bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa de'i tshe bdag gis thos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: upon the seat of sun and moon, and so on, when the Bhagavān was dwelling, at that time I heard.

original: bzhugs so zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi gnas pa bzhis bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhugs so zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi gnas pa bzhis bzhugs pa'o //
translated: “Dwelling” means dwelling through the four bases of supernatural powers.

original: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi gnas pa bzhi ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi gnas pa bzhi ni gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four bases of supernatural powers?

original: ston pa'i gnas pa dang / spyod lam gyi gnas pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas pa dang / nang du yang dag 'jog gi gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ston pa'i gnas pa dang / spyod lam gyi gnas pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas pa dang / nang du yang dag 'jog gi gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called the dwelling of the teacher, the dwelling of conduct, the dwelling of meditative equipoise, and the dwelling of inner correct placement.

original: de la gang zhig bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung gi las thams cad ni ston pa'i gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang zhig bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung gi las thams cad ni ston pa'i gnas pa'o //
translated: In this regard, all the activities of speech of the Lord are the abode of teaching.

original: gang zhig sku'i phrin las thams cad ni spyod lam gyi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig sku'i phrin las thams cad ni spyod lam gyi gnas pa'o //
translated: All the activities of body are the abode of conduct.

original: gang zhig bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa la yid kyi las thams cad rang bzhin gyis mnyam par gzhag pa ste //
analyzed: gang zhig bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa la yid kyi las thams cad rang bzhin gyis mnyam par gzhag pa ste //
translated: All the activities of mind, such as meditative concentration and equipoise, are the natural meditative concentration.

original: de rnams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas pa'o //
translated: These are the abodes of meditative equipoise.

original: gang zhig lha la sogs pa'i nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa rnams la rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i yid kyi las de nang du yang dag 'jog gi @6b gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig lha la sogs pa'i nye bar 'gro ba la sogs pa rnams la rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i yid kyi las de nang du yang dag 'jog gi @6b gnas pa ste /
translated: All the activities of mind that are naturally pure in the movements of gods and so forth are the abode of inner composure.

original: phyi'i bshad pa'o //🔽nang du ae zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang / de'i mtshan ma dang / de'i rtsa ba dang / de'i rig pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i bshad pa'o // nang du ae zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang / de'i mtshan ma dang / de'i rtsa ba dang / de'i rig pa'o //
translated: This is the external explanation.🔽The inner explanation is that the letter e is wisdom, its sign, its root, and its knowledge.

original: bam yig gis thabs dang / de'i rgyal mtshan dang / de'i rtsa ba dang de'i rig pa'o //
analyzed: bam yig gis thabs dang / de'i rgyal mtshan dang / de'i rtsa ba dang de'i rig pa'o //
translated: The letter vaṃ is method, its banner, its root, and its knowledge.

original: thig les ni de dang yang dag par sbyor bas thig le'i ngo bo bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: thig les ni de dang yang dag par sbyor bas thig le'i ngo bo bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: By the drop, one experiences the essence of the drop, which is great bliss, by being perfectly united with it.

original: 'dis kyang don dam pa'i bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba sngon du 'gro bas chos kyi sku mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis kyang don dam pa'i bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba sngon du 'gro bas chos kyi sku mtshon pa'o //
translated: This also indicates the Dharma Body, since it is preceded by the experience of ultimate great bliss.

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba 'dis ni aa ham gi ngo bos rgyud dang ye shes kyi rim pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis thig le bzhi'i ngo bos 'khor lo bzhi la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mtshon pa'o//
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba 'dis ni aa ham gi ngo bos rgyud dang ye shes kyi rim pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis thig le bzhi'i ngo bos 'khor lo bzhi la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mtshon pa'o//
translated: By the word “I,” one indicates the Enjoyment Body in the four wheels by the nature of the continuum and intuition, by the nature of the four drops, by the nature of the “I am” state.

original: thos pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'dzag pa'i don gyis sprul pa'i sku mtshon to //
analyzed: thos pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'dzag pa'i don gyis sprul pa'i sku mtshon to //
translated: By the word “heard,” one indicates the Emanation Body, by the meaning of “dripping.”

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: gcig ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ste //
analyzed: gcig ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ste //
translated: One is like the sky,

original: gzhan ni zla ba rdzogs pa 'dra //
analyzed: gzhan ni zla ba rdzogs pa 'dra //
translated: and the other is like a full moon.

original: mkha' 'dra gang zhig 'di dag gi //
analyzed: mkha' 'dra gang zhig 'di dag gi //
translated: That which is like the sky

original: skyob pa rnams kyi chos sku de //
analyzed: skyob pa rnams kyi chos sku de //
translated: is the Dharma Body of the Protectors.

original: gang zhig zla ba rdzogs pa ltar //
analyzed: gang zhig zla ba rdzogs pa ltar //
translated: That which is like a full moon

original: de nyid longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mtshon pa'o //
translated: is the Enjoyment Body of the Protectors.

original: dus gcig na zhes bya ba 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus gsungs so //
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes bya ba 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus gsungs so //
translated: The expression at one time indicates the inconceivable time.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bzang ba'i dus dang ngan pa'i dus //
analyzed: bzang ba'i dus dang ngan pa'i dus //
translated: Good time and bad time,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab dus nyid dang // sna yi bu ga gnyis nas ni //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab dus nyid dang // sna yi bu ga gnyis nas ni //
translated: inconceivable time,

original: 'ongs pa bzang po'i dus zhes brjod //
analyzed: 'ongs pa bzang po'i dus zhes brjod //
translated: the time of the good is said to be🔽that which comes from the two nostrils,

original: song ba dus ngan zhes brjod do //
analyzed: song ba dus ngan zhes brjod do //
translated: the bad time is said to be🔽that which goes out.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab de bzhin 'gyur //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab de bzhin 'gyur //
translated: The inconceivable is just like that.

original: srog dang rtsol ba rnam spangs pa //
analyzed: srog dang rtsol ba rnam spangs pa //
translated: Abandoning the life-force and exertion,🔽abandoning the exhalation and inhalation,

original: 'byung dang 'jug pa spangs pa dang // 'gro dang 'ong las rnam grol ba //
analyzed: 'byung dang 'jug pa spangs pa dang // 'gro dang 'ong las rnam grol ba //
translated: free from going and coming,

original: dus gcig ces ni brjod pa min //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dus gcig ces ni brjod pa min // zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is not called 'at one time.'

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba 'dis ni dga' ba gsum 'joms par byed pa'i lhan cig skyes pa brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba 'dis ni dga' ba gsum 'joms par byed pa'i lhan cig skyes pa brjod pa yin no //
translated: The expression 'Blessed One' indicates the innate nature that destroys the three joys.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis sdud par byed pa'i 'khor lo bzhi'am drug rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis sdud par byed pa'i 'khor lo bzhi'am drug rnams te /
translated: All the Tathagatas are the four or six wheels that gather the seventy-two thousand channels.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of being the very nature of all the Tathagatas.

original: de rnams kyi sku gsung thugs ni de sdud par byed pa'i rnam pa can rtsa gsum mo //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sku gsung thugs ni de sdud par byed pa'i rnam pa can rtsa gsum mo //
translated: Their body, speech, and mind are the three channels, which have the form of collecting them.

original: de nyid ni snying po ste rtsa gsum po de'i dbang gis rtsa gzhan rnams bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni snying po ste rtsa gsum po de'i dbang gis rtsa gzhan rnams bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself is the essence, because the other channels are generated by the power of those three channels.

original: de'i ngo bo'i rdo rje btsun mo rnams ni las dang dam tshig dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i ngo bo rnams so //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo'i rdo rje btsun mo rnams ni las dang dam tshig dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i ngo bo rnams so //
translated: The Vajra Queens who are of that nature are of the nature of action, pledge, and wisdom seals.

original: de rnams kyi bha ga rnams ni kun rdzob tu chos 'byung gi lte ba'i gnas rnams la gang @7a * //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bha ga rnams ni kun rdzob tu chos 'byung gi lte ba'i gnas rnams la gang @7a * //
translated: Their bhagas are the places of the center of the Dharma source, conventionally.

original: gi tshe thig le'i ngo bos gnas pa mdzad pa de'i tshe bdag gis thos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gi tshe thig le'i ngo bos gnas pa mdzad pa de'i tshe bdag gis thos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: When they abide in the nature of the drops, then it is said that “I heard. ”

original: nang gi bshad pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the inner explanation.

original: de ltar gleng gzhi bshad nas 'khor phun sum tshogs pa rgyas par bshad par bstan par 'dod nas //
analyzed: de ltar gleng gzhi bshad nas 'khor phun sum tshogs pa rgyas par bshad par bstan par 'dod nas //
translated: Thus, having explained the nidana, in order to explain extensively the excellent retinue, it is said:

original: tshad med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: tshad med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: “Immeasurable” and so forth.

original: 'di tsam nyid du gzhal bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di tsam nyid du gzhal bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir tshad med pa'o //
translated: It is immeasurable because it cannot be evaluated as just this much.

original: phyag rgya chen po zhes bya ba ni dga' ba chen po len pas na phyag rgya chen po ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po zhes bya ba ni dga' ba chen po len pas na phyag rgya chen po ste /
translated: The so-called great seal is the great seal because it takes up great joy.

original: shin tu zab pa ma yin pa dang shin tu zab pa'i rim pas rdzogs pa'i skur brjod do //
analyzed: shin tu zab pa ma yin pa dang shin tu zab pa'i rim pas rdzogs pa'i skur brjod do //
translated: It is called the perfect body by the stages of not being very profound and being very profound.

original: de'i don du mngon par rdzogs pa spros pa'i rgyud rdo rje dang zla ba la sogs pa'i rim pa dang rigs brgya'i dbye ba bsgom pa gang zhig mngon par rtogs pa de la bzhugs pa ni gnas pa gang rnams la yod pa de ni de ltar ro //
analyzed: de'i don du mngon par rdzogs pa spros pa'i rgyud rdo rje dang zla ba la sogs pa'i rim pa dang rigs brgya'i dbye ba bsgom pa gang zhig mngon par rtogs pa de la bzhugs pa ni gnas pa gang rnams la yod pa de ni de ltar ro //
translated: For that purpose, the perfection of the stage of the vajra and moon, etc., and the meditation of the division of the hundred families is the clear realization. Those who abide in that are those who exist in those abodes.

original: dpag tu med pa rdo rje'i rigs dang / rab tu 'brel ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sngags kyi sgo nas spyad pa spyod pa ste /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa rdo rje'i rigs dang / rab tu 'brel ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sngags kyi sgo nas spyad pa spyod pa ste /
translated: The immeasurable is the vajra family, and the bodhisattvas who are thoroughly connected practice the conduct through the door of mantra.

original: byang chub ni sku gsum gyi rnam pa can la sems dpa' ni dgongs pa gang la yod pa de rnams de ltar ro //
analyzed: byang chub ni sku gsum gyi rnam pa can la sems dpa' ni dgongs pa gang la yod pa de rnams de ltar ro //
translated: Awakening is the form of the three bodies, and the bodhisattvas are those who have the intention. Those are like that.

original: de rnams kyi bye ba ni 'bum phrag bcu'i rnam pa'o //🔽de rnams kyi khrag khrig ni sa ya'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bye ba ni 'bum phrag bcu'i rnam pa'o // de rnams kyi khrag khrig ni sa ya'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The word lakṣa is a synonym for ten thousands.🔽The word sahasra is a synonym for ten hundreds.🔽The word śata is a synonym for ten.🔽The word daśa is a synonym for one.

original: de'i grangs brgya stong ni 'bum mo //
analyzed: de'i grangs brgya stong ni 'bum mo //
translated: The word eka is a synonym for one.🔽The word eva is a synonym for just.🔽The word ca is a synonym for and.🔽The word api is a synonym for even.🔽The word vā is a synonym for or.🔽The word ca is a synonym for also.

original: de'i grangs kyis ni rnam par bcad pa dang lhan cig tu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de'i grangs kyis ni rnam par bcad pa dang lhan cig tu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: The word api is a synonym for even.🔽The word vā is a synonym for or.🔽The word ca is a synonym for also.

original: de'i phyir thams cad kyang zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽phyag rgya chen po'i mngon par rtogs par zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad kyang zhes bya ba gsungs te / phyag rgya chen po'i mngon par rtogs par zhes bya ba la /
translated: The word api is a synonym for even.🔽The word vā is a synonym for or.🔽The word ca is a synonym for also.🔽The word api is a synonym for even.🔽The word vā is a synonym for or.🔽The word ca is a synonym for also.🔽The word api is a synonym for even.🔽The word vā is a synonym for or.🔽The word ca is a synonym for also.🔽The word api is a synonym for even.

original: phyag rgya chen po ni ngag 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin rnam pa med pa sngar bshad pa'i tshig nyid kyis so //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po ni ngag 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin rnam pa med pa sngar bshad pa'i tshig nyid kyis so //
translated: The word vā is a synonym for or.🔽The word ca is a synonym for also.🔽The word api is a synonym for even.🔽The word vā is a synonym for or.🔽The word ca is a synonym for also.🔽The word api is a synonym for even.🔽The word vā is a synonym for or.🔽The word ca is a synonym for also.🔽The word api is a synonym for even.🔽The word vā is a synonym for or.🔽The word ca is a synonym for also.🔽The word api is a synonym for even.🔽The word vā is a synonym for or.🔽The word ca is a synonym for also.🔽The word api is a synonym for even.🔽The word vā is a synonym for or.🔽The word ca is a synonym for also.🔽The word api is a synonym for even.🔽The word vā is a synonym for or.🔽The word ca is a synonym for also.🔽The word api is a synonym for even.🔽The word vā is a synonym for or.🔽The word ca is a synonym for also.

original: de'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa ni thob par byed pa'i thabs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa ni thob par byed pa'i thabs te /
translated: The word api is a synonym for even.🔽The word

original: rgyas par ni brgya rtsa brgyad kyis rlung gi grangs can dang bsdu na yang rlung bcu'i rnam pa'i grangs nye bar mtshon pa sngon du 'gro bas 'jug pa la sogs pa gsum gyi grangs kyis nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'i dbugs kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rgyas par ni brgya rtsa brgyad kyis rlung gi grangs can dang bsdu na yang rlung bcu'i rnam pa'i grangs nye bar mtshon pa sngon du 'gro bas 'jug pa la sogs pa gsum gyi grangs kyis nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'i dbugs kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: In detail, it is the number of the winds, which are one hundred and eight; in brief, it is the number of the ten winds, which are twenty-four thousand.

original: de la gnas par 'gro ba gang rnams la yod pa de ni mngon du byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la gnas par 'gro ba gang rnams la yod pa de ni mngon du byed pa ste /
translated: The one who has that is the one who actualizes it.

original: bsgom pa rab kyi mthar thug par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa rab kyi mthar thug par 'gro ba'o //
translated: He goes to the culmination of the highest meditation.

original: de la gnas pa ni de mngon du byed pa la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni de mngon du byed pa la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The one who abides in that is the one who abides in the actualization of that.

original: 'dis ni rdo rje bzlas pa mngon du bye ba'i byang chub sems dpa' la bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rdo rje bzlas pa mngon du bye ba'i byang chub sems dpa' la bstan to //
translated: This is taught for the bodhisattva who actualizes vajra repetition.

original: gzhan yang ji lta bu rnams kyis shes na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji lta bu rnams kyis shes na /
translated: Moreover, if one asks, “By whom is it known?”

original: de'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i bde ba chen po zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i bde ba chen po zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “By the one who knows nondual great bliss.”

original: gnyis med ni gzung 'dzin dang @7b rnam par bral bar sems can thams cad la khyab pa bde ba chen po sems 'od gsal ba'i rnam pa de'i nyams su myong ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis med ni gzung 'dzin dang @7b rnam par bral bar sems can thams cad la khyab pa bde ba chen po sems 'od gsal ba'i rnam pa de'i nyams su myong ba ni /
translated: The experience of that aspect of the clear light mind, the great bliss, which is nondual, free from the division of object and subject, and pervades all sentient beings,

original: snang ba la sogs pa ye shes gsum gyi sgo nas rig pa des dgyes pa ni khyad par can gyi bde ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa ye shes gsum gyi sgo nas rig pa des dgyes pa ni khyad par can gyi bde ba'o //
translated: is the delight of that knowledge through the three intuitions such as the appearance intuition, which is the special bliss.

original: des khab byed pa ni rab tu rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: des khab byed pa ni rab tu rgyas pa'o //
translated: The expansion of that is the full extent.

original: mchog ni khyad par 'phags pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: mchog ni khyad par 'phags pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The supreme is the nature of the exalted.

original: zhal gyi padma ni gang gis de rnams de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: zhal gyi padma ni gang gis de rnams de bzhin du'o //
translated: The lotus face is the one by whom they are so.

original: 'dis ni sems rnam par dben pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: 'dis ni sems rnam par dben pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: This is the meaning of the perfections of the mind isolation.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas de chos rnams thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa rnams sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyi ji lta ba bzhin ni sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyi rnam pa nyams su myong ba ni ye shes te
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas de chos rnams thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa rnams sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyi ji lta ba bzhin ni sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyi rnam pa nyams su myong ba ni ye shes te
translated: Similarly, by all phenomena, etc., all phenomena are the aggregates, etc., which are experienced in the aspect of the twelve examples of illusion, and the intuition is the intuition of the twelve examples of illusion.

original: / de mthong ba ni mngon du byed pa'i phyir bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽gzhan yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi zhes bya ba la /🔽rnam par mi rtog pa ni phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pa dag gis rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ye shes ni thams cad stong pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: / de mthong ba ni mngon du byed pa'i phyir bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i don to // gzhan yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi zhes bya ba la / rnam par mi rtog pa ni phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pa dag gis rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ye shes ni thams cad stong pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The perfection of the stage of self-consecration is the meaning of the word, because it is the seeing of that, i.e., the perfection of the stage of self-consecration, which is the making manifest of that.🔽Moreover, the perfection of the stage of self-consecration is the meaning of the word, because it is the seeing of that, i.e., the perfection of the stage of self-consecration, which is the making manifest of that.🔽Moreover, the perfection of the stage of self-consecration is the meaning of the word, because it is the seeing of that, i.e., the perfection of the stage of self-consecration, which is the making manifest of that.🔽Moreover, the perfection of the stage of self-consecration is the meaning of the word, because it is the seeing of that, i.e., the perfection of the stage of self-consecration, which is the making manifest of that.🔽Moreover, the perfection of the stage of self-consecration is the meaning of the word, because it is the seeing of that, i.e., the perfection of the stage of self-consecration, which is the making manifest of that.🔽Moreover, the perfection of the stage of self-consecration is the meaning of the word, because it is the seeing of that, i.e., the perfection of the stage of self-consecration, which is the making manifest of that.

original: de bzhin ni de kho na nyid de bag chags su gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyi tshogs spong ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir phyin ci ma log pa'o //
