analyzed: de bzhin ni de kho na nyid de bag chags su gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyi tshogs spong ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the perfection of the stage of self-consecration is the meaning of the word, because it is the seeing of that, i.e., the perfection of the stage of self-consecration, which is the making manifest of that.🔽Moreover, the perfection of the stage of self-consecration is the meaning of the word, because it is the seeing of that, i.e., the perfection of the stage of self-consecration, which is the making manifest of that.

original: de la mngon du phyogs pa ni mngon du phyogs pa'i 'gyur ba rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la mngon du phyogs pa ni mngon du phyogs pa'i 'gyur ba rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Moreover, the perfection of the stage of self-consecration is the meaning of the word, because it is the seeing of that, i.e., the perfection of the stage of self-consecration, which is the making manifest of that.

original: 'dis ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa mthar phyin pa nyid du 'di rnams kyis bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa mthar phyin pa nyid du 'di rnams kyis bstan to //
translated: Moreover, the perfection of the stage of self-consecration is the

original: de bzhin du bla na med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bla na med pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po ni zung 'jug gi rnam pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du bla na med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bla na med pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po ni zung 'jug gi rnam pa /
translated: Likewise, in the phrase “the unsurpassed, etc.,” the unsurpassed great Vajradhara is the form of union.

original: don dam pa de mi slob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa de mi slob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ultimate is not subject to training.

original: de'i dam tshig ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i ngo bo zung 'jug mngon du byed pa'i thabs te /
analyzed: de'i dam tshig ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i ngo bo zung 'jug mngon du byed pa'i thabs te /
translated: His pledge is the means of realizing the nature of union, which is both subject to training and not subject to training.

original: de las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not transgressed.

original: des dbang du gyur pa ni rang dbang can te /
analyzed: des dbang du gyur pa ni rang dbang can te /
translated: One who is mastered by it is independent.

original: bdag byin gyis brlab pa dang mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa gnyis tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo de la rab tu mkhas pa /
analyzed: bdag byin gyis brlab pa dang mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa gnyis tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo de la rab tu mkhas pa /
translated: One who is skilled in that nature, which is the indivisibility of the two stages of self-consecration and manifest enlightenment,🔽is one who realizes it.

original: de mngon du byed pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de mngon du byed pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the phrase “by those who realize it.”

original: 'dis ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa mthar phyin pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa mthar phyin pa nyid bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of the stage of union.

original: de ltar 'khor phun sum tshogs pa mdor bstan par mdzad nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'khor phun sum tshogs pa mdor bstan par mdzad nas /
translated: Having thus presented in brief the excellence of the retinue,🔽now, in order to present the excellence of the place, the text reads:

original: de'i rgyas par bshad pa'i yan lag gtso bo bstan par 'dod nas ji tsam gyis dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yongs su rdzogs pa de tsam gyi grangs dang @8a * //
analyzed: de'i rgyas par bshad pa'i yan lag gtso bo bstan par 'dod nas ji tsam gyis dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yongs su rdzogs pa de tsam gyi grangs dang @8a * //
translated: Wishing to teach the principal limbs of its extensive explanation, he declares, “To the extent that the maṇḍala circle is complete, to that extent there is the number of the assembly of retinue, namely,

original: ldan pa'i 'khor gyi tshogs 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ldan pa'i 'khor gyi tshogs 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: such and such.”

original: 'dis ni mngon sum gyis yongs su bgrang ba ston par byed de /
analyzed: 'dis ni mngon sum gyis yongs su bgrang ba ston par byed de /
translated: This shows the enumeration by direct perception.

original: dam tshig rdo rje dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dam tshig rdo rje dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The pledge vajra” is Amoghasiddhi,

original: las thams cad pa nyid kyis dam tshig thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir dang / dam tshig nyams pa rnams la de'i rnal 'byor gyis slar dam tshig ster ba'i phyir dang / 'du byed kyi phung po rnam par dag par bsgrubs pas 'da' bar mi bya ba nyid kyi phyir dam tshig rdo rje ni don yod grub pa ste des so //
analyzed: las thams cad pa nyid kyis dam tshig thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir dang / dam tshig nyams pa rnams la de'i rnal 'byor gyis slar dam tshig ster ba'i phyir dang / 'du byed kyi phung po rnam par dag par bsgrubs pas 'da' bar mi bya ba nyid kyi phyir dam tshig rdo rje ni don yod grub pa ste des so //
translated: because of being the essence of all pledges by virtue of being the one for all activities, and because of granting the pledge again by his yoga to those who have transgressed the pledge, and because of being the one not to be transgressed by virtue of accomplishing the purification of the aggregate of compositional factors.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni byang chub ni sku gsum gyi ngo bo nyid de chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni byang chub ni sku gsum gyi ngo bo nyid de chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “bodhisattva” is as follows: “Enlightenment” is the nature of the three bodies, because it is the realization of all phenomena just as they are.🔽“Heroic mind” is that which has the intention to actualize the transcendent state.🔽“Great hero” is the great one, which is the benefit of others.

original: de la sems dpa' ni dgongs pa mngon du byed pa'i 'dun pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la sems dpa' ni dgongs pa mngon du byed pa'i 'dun pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: “Heroic mind” is that which has the intention to actualize the transcendent state.

original: sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ni chen po ni gzhan don te /🔽de la sems dpa' gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ni chen po ni gzhan don te / de la sems dpa' gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: “Great hero” is the great one, which is the benefit of others.🔽“Heroic mind” is that which has the intention to actualize the transcendent state.

original: dam tshig gnyis pa 'dis ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: dam tshig gnyis pa 'dis ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa nyid du gsungs so //
translated: This second pledge declares the possession of the perfection of one’s own and others’ goals.

original: zhe sdang rdo rje dang zhes bya ba la zhe sdang ni zhe sdang gi rnam par dag pa de ni de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang rdo rje dang zhes bya ba la zhe sdang ni zhe sdang gi rnam par dag pa de ni de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “Vajra of hatred” is as follows: Hatred is the purity of hatred, because it is the nature of reality.

original: de nyid ni rdo rje stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni rdo rje stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is a “vajra,” because it is the nature of emptiness.

original: yang na rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i yul gang zhig tha mal ba'i nga rgyal gang yin pa de la zhe sdang ba'i phyir zhe sdang yin la rdo rje yang yin te /
analyzed: yang na rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i yul gang zhig tha mal ba'i nga rgyal gang yin pa de la zhe sdang ba'i phyir zhe sdang yin la rdo rje yang yin te /
translated: Or, since it is hatred for any object of the aggregate of consciousness that is ordinary pride, it is hatred and also a vajra.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes nyid kyi phyir zhe sdang rdo rje ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes nyid kyi phyir zhe sdang rdo rje ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Since it is the pristine consciousness of the completely pure dharmadhātu itself, Hatred Vajra is Akṣobhya.

original: 'dod chags rdo rje zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags rnam par dag pa'i phyir 'dod chags kyang yin la rdo rje yang yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags rdo rje zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags rnam par dag pa'i phyir 'dod chags kyang yin la rdo rje yang yin te /
translated: “ Attachment vajra” is attachment and also a vajra because of the purity of attachment.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir 'dod chags rdo rje'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir 'dod chags rdo rje'o //
translated: Since it is the essence of emptiness, it is attachment vajra.

original: yang na 'dod chags ni 'du shes kyi phung po la thog ma med pa'i tha mal ba'i rnam par rtog pa la zhen pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'dod chags ni 'du shes kyi phung po la thog ma med pa'i tha mal ba'i rnam par rtog pa la zhen pa'o //
translated: Or, attachment is the conception of the aggregate of perception as the beginningless ordinary conception.

original: de yang yin la rdo rje yang yin pas so sor kun tu rtog pa'i ye shes kyi phyir 'dod chags rdo rje snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: de yang yin la rdo rje yang yin pas so sor kun tu rtog pa'i ye shes kyi phyir 'dod chags rdo rje snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: Since it is that and also a vajra, it is the pristine consciousness of individual discernment, and therefore Attachment Vajra is Amitābha.

original: rtag pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba la lus kyi yul gzugs kyi phung po la gang zhig rtag pa zhes 'dzin pa des de yang rdo rje yang yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba la lus kyi yul gzugs kyi phung po la gang zhig rtag pa zhes 'dzin pa des de yang rdo rje yang yin te /
translated: The one who apprehends the eternal in the form aggregate, the object of the body, that is also a vajra,

original: stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i phyir rtag pa'i rdo rje ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i phyir rtag pa'i rdo rje ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: because of realizing emptiness. Eternal vajra is Vairochana.

original: yang na me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyis rtag tu de nyid du gnas pa'i phyir rtag pa ni rnam par snang mdzad de rdo rje yang yin te /
analyzed: yang na me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyis rtag tu de nyid du gnas pa'i phyir rtag pa ni rnam par snang mdzad de rdo rje yang yin te /
translated: Or, he is eternal because he always abides in reality by the nature of mirror-like wisdom. He is also a vajra,

original: de'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir rtag pa'i rdo rje'o//
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir rtag pa'i rdo rje'o//
translated: because he is the nature of that. Eternal vajra is Vairochana.

original: @8b ye shes rdo rje dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @8b ye shes rdo rje dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The one called “wisdom vajra” is Amitābha.

original: ye shes ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: ye shes ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: Wisdom is the wisdom of equality.

original: ye shes kyang yin la rdo rje yang yin te tshor ba'i phung po stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ye shes kyang yin la rdo rje yang yin te tshor ba'i phung po stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir //
translated: It is also a vajra, because of realizing the aggregate of feeling as emptiness.

original: ye shes rdo rje ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: ye shes rdo rje ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: Wisdom vajra is Amitābha.

original: yang na nga rgyal rnam pa bdun gyis mtho ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi ye shes rdo rje yang yin te /
analyzed: yang na nga rgyal rnam pa bdun gyis mtho ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi ye shes rdo rje yang yin te /
translated: Or else, it is the vajra of intuition, which has the characteristic of being exalted by the seven kinds of pride.

original: de la stong pa nyid nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ye shes rdo rje ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ye shes rdo rje ni de nyid do //
translated: The vajra of intuition is that itself, because of the nature of the experience of emptiness.

original: sa rdo rje dang zhes bya ba ni sra ba'i rang bzhin sa'i khams la stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir sa'i khams ni spyan ma'o //
analyzed: sa rdo rje dang zhes bya ba ni sra ba'i rang bzhin sa'i khams la stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir sa'i khams ni spyan ma'o //
translated: The vajra of earth is Locanā, because of the realization of the earth element as emptiness, the nature of solidity.

original: yang na rang gi lus la sra ba gang yin pa de ni sa ste /
analyzed: yang na rang gi lus la sra ba gang yin pa de ni sa ste /
translated: Or else, the earth is that which is solid in one’s own body.

original: de la mi dmigs pa rtogs pa'i phyir sa'i rdo rje ni de nyid do //🔽chu rdo rje dang zhes bya ba ni gsher ba'i ngo bo chu rnams te /🔽de rnams kyi rdo rje ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyams su myong ba nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: de la mi dmigs pa rtogs pa'i phyir sa'i rdo rje ni de nyid do // chu rdo rje dang zhes bya ba ni gsher ba'i ngo bo chu rnams te / de rnams kyi rdo rje ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyams su myong ba nyid kyi phyir //
translated: The vajra of earth is that itself, because of the realization of the non-apprehension of that.🔽The vajra of water is Māmakī, because of the experience of the nature of emptiness of the waters, the nature of fluidity.

original: de la chu rdo rje ni m'a ma k'i'o //
analyzed: de la chu rdo rje ni m'a ma k'i'o //
translated: The vajra of water is that itself, because of the experience of the nature of emptiness of those.

original: yang na rang gi lus su gtogs pa'i khrag la sogs pa gsher ba'i rang bzhin ni chu ste /
analyzed: yang na rang gi lus su gtogs pa'i khrag la sogs pa gsher ba'i rang bzhin ni chu ste /
translated: Or else, the nature of moisture in one’s own body, such as blood, is water.

original: de rnams rdo rje ni stong pa nyid nyams su myong ba'i phyir chu rdo rje ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams rdo rje ni stong pa nyid nyams su myong ba'i phyir chu rdo rje ni de nyid do //
translated: That vajra is the water vajra, because it is the realization of emptiness.

original: me rdo rje dang zhes bya ba ni drod kyi rang bzhin ni me ste de'i rdo rje ni sngon bzhin me rdo rje gos dkar no'o //
analyzed: me rdo rje dang zhes bya ba ni drod kyi rang bzhin ni me ste de'i rdo rje ni sngon bzhin me rdo rje gos dkar no'o //
translated: The fire vajra, etc. The nature of heat is fire. Its vajra is the fire vajra, as before, Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: yang na rang gi lus la gnas pa'i dro ba ni me ste de'i rdo rje ni sngon bzhin me rdo rje de nyid do //
analyzed: yang na rang gi lus la gnas pa'i dro ba ni me ste de'i rdo rje ni sngon bzhin me rdo rje de nyid do //
translated: Or else, the heat that abides in one’s own body is fire. Its vajra is the fire vajra, as before, that very thing.

original: rlung rdo rje dang zhes bya ba la sogs par g-yo bar byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir rlung ngo //
analyzed: rlung rdo rje dang zhes bya ba la sogs par g-yo bar byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir rlung ngo //
translated: The wind vajra, etc. Wind is the nature of movement.

original: de'i rdo rje ni sngon bzhin mi dmigs pa rtogs pa'i phyir rlung rdo rje sgrol ma'o //
analyzed: de'i rdo rje ni sngon bzhin mi dmigs pa rtogs pa'i phyir rlung rdo rje sgrol ma'o //
translated: Its vajra is the wind vajra, as before, because it is the realization of non-apprehension, Tārā.

original: yang na rang gi lus kyis bsgrub par bya ba 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa ni rlung ngo //
analyzed: yang na rang gi lus kyis bsgrub par bya ba 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa ni rlung ngo //
translated: Or else, the wind is the going and coming, etc., that are to be accomplished by one’s own body.

original: de la stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i phyir rlung rdo rje ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i phyir rlung rdo rje ni de nyid do //
translated: The wind-vajra is that very [wind] because it is for the sake of realizing emptiness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ni sngon bzhin no //🔽de lta bu'i gtso bor gyur pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ni sngon bzhin no // de lta bu'i gtso bor gyur pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva is as before.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang lha mo bzhi gtso bor gyur pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang lha mo bzhi gtso bor gyur pa rnams kyis so //
translated: The suchness is the suchness of the five buddhas and four goddesses.

original: dam tshig chen po'i rigs dang 'brel ba zhes bya ba la dam tshig chen po ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: dam tshig chen po'i rigs dang 'brel ba zhes bya ba la dam tshig chen po ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: The great pledge family is the great pledge of Mahāvajradhara.

original: de'i rigs dang 'brel pa'i zhes bya ba ni de'i rigs las yang dag par 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rigs dang 'brel pa'i zhes bya ba ni de'i rigs las yang dag par 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The connected means arisen from that family.

original: yang na dam tshig chen po ni don yod rdo rje'o //
analyzed: yang na dam tshig chen po ni don yod rdo rje'o //
translated: Or, the great pledge is Amoghavajra.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dam tshig gi sdom pa la sogs pa gzung ba sngon du 'gro bas rim pa gnyis la thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa rnams kyis de'i go 'phang thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dam tshig gi sdom pa la sogs pa gzung ba sngon du 'gro bas rim pa gnyis la thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa rnams kyis de'i go 'phang thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is connected because of taking up the vows of the pledge of all buddhas and so forth, and then attaining that state through hearing, reflection, and meditation on the two stages.

original: de'i rigs ni rgyud sde de dang 'brel ba'i las kyi @9a * //
analyzed: de'i rigs ni rgyud sde de dang 'brel ba'i las kyi @9a * //
translated: The latter is the activity that is related to that tantra.🔽

original: rigs la brten pas ma lus pa'i rigs la 'jug par 'dod pa'i phyir dang / las thams cad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs la brten pas ma lus pa'i rigs la 'jug par 'dod pa'i phyir dang / las thams cad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That type is based on the family of the karma of that Tantra, because it is desired to enter all families, and because it is all-action.

original: grangs ji tsam dang ldan pa zhe na /
analyzed: grangs ji tsam dang ldan pa zhe na /
translated: How many are there?

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis dang zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis dang zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “with seventy-two thousand Bodhisattvas.”

original: rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi rnam par dag pas thabs shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi rnam par dag pas thabs shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the purity of seventy-two thousand channels, it is the nature of method and wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sgra'i don ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sgra'i don ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the word Bodhisattva has been explained previously.

original: gzhan yang rigs chen po dang 'bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong zhes bya ba la gzhan zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs chen po dang 'bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong zhes bya ba la gzhan zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag rnams so //
translated: Moreover, it is said, “with a hundred thousand koṭis of niyutas of Bodhisattvas who are separated from the Great Family.” “ Moreover” means others.

original: rigs chen po zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rigs so //
analyzed: rigs chen po zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rigs so //
translated: “ Great Family” is the family of Great Vajradhara.

original: de dang 'brel ba zhes bya ba ni de'i rigs can rnams so //
analyzed: de dang 'brel ba zhes bya ba ni de'i rigs can rnams so //
translated: “Related to that” means those of that type.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi sgo'i spyad pa spyod pa rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi sgo'i spyad pa spyod pa rnams so //
translated: “Bodhisattvas” means those who practice the conduct of the gateway of mantra.

original: de rnams kyi dbye ba ni 'bum phrag bcu'i grangs kyis yongs su spyad pa de tsam gyis grangs kyi dbye bas dbye bar byas pa'i khrag khrig ni sa ya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbye ba ni 'bum phrag bcu'i grangs kyis yongs su spyad pa de tsam gyis grangs kyi dbye bas dbye bar byas pa'i khrag khrig ni sa ya'o //
translated: “Their divisions” are the divisions of the enumeration of that practice, which is the enumeration of a quintillion.

original: brgya stong pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: brgya stong pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “A hundred thousand” is as before.

original: de ltar gtso bor rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar gtso bor rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus explained the extensive explanation of the main topic,

original: de'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to explain the explanation that is a branch of that,

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “thus” and so on are stated.

original: nam mkha' la 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽nam mkha'i sgras ni rna mchog gi nang na gnas pa'i nam mkha' brjod de /
analyzed: nam mkha' la 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / nam mkha'i sgras ni rna mchog gi nang na gnas pa'i nam mkha' brjod de /
translated: In “moving in space” and so on,🔽the term “space” refers to the space that exists inside the ear cakra.

original: der 'gro ba'i nam mkha' la 'gro ba ni sgra ste /
analyzed: der 'gro ba'i nam mkha' la 'gro ba ni sgra ste /
translated: Moving in that space is sound.

original: sgra rdo rje'i ngo bo byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgra rdo rje'i ngo bo byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The essence of the vajra of sound is the bodhisattva called “the one who is the essence of the vajra of sound.”🔽The bodhisattva called “the one who is the essence of the vajra of sound” is the one who is the essence of the vajra of sound.🔽The one who is the essence of the vajra of sound is the one who is the essence of the vajra of sound.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽nam mkha' rnam par rgyas pa dang // zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no // nam mkha' rnam par rgyas pa dang // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The one who is the essence of the vajra of sound is the one who is the essence of the vajra of sound.

original: de la nam mkha' ni nam mkha' ste sgrib pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid can no //🔽de la rnam par rgyas pa ni bskyed 'gags pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang la yod pa de nam mkha' rnam par rgyas pa ste yul gzugs so //
analyzed: de la nam mkha' ni nam mkha' ste sgrib pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid can no // de la rnam par rgyas pa ni bskyed 'gags pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang la yod pa de nam mkha' rnam par rgyas pa ste yul gzugs so //
translated: The one who is the essence of the vajra of sound is the one who is the essence of the vajra of sound.🔽The one who is the essence of the vajra of sound is the one who is the essence of the vajra of sound.🔽The one who is the essence of the vajra of sound is the one who is the essence of the vajra of sound.🔽The one who is the essence of the vajra of sound is the one who is the essence of the vajra of sound.

original: de nyid byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs rdo rje zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽nam mkha'i dri dang zhes bya ba ni de la nam mkha' ni sna'i nam mkha'o //
analyzed: de nyid byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs rdo rje zhes bya ba'i don to // nam mkha'i dri dang zhes bya ba ni de la nam mkha' ni sna'i nam mkha'o //
translated: The one who is the essence of the vajra of sound is the one who is the essence of the vajra of sound.🔽The one who is the essence of the vajra of sound is the one who is the essence of the vajra of sound.🔽The one who is the essence of the vajra of sound is the one who is the essence of the vajra of sound.🔽The one who is the essence of the vajra of sound is the one who is the essence of the vajra of sound.🔽The one who is the essence of the vajra of sound is the one who is the essence of the vajra of sound.🔽The one who is the essence of the vajra of sound is the one who is the essence of the vajra of sound.🔽The one who is the essence of the vajra of sound is the one who is the essence of the vajra of sound.🔽The one who is the essence of the vajra of sound is the one who is the essence of the vajra of sound.🔽The one who is the essence of the vajra of sound is the one who is the essence of the vajra of sound.

original: de nas dri'i yul bsnam pa'i phyir dri rdo rje zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nas dri'i yul bsnam pa'i phyir dri rdo rje zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The one who is the essence of the vajra of sound is the one who is the essence of the vajra of sound.🔽The one who is the essence of the vajra of sound is the one who is the essence

original: nam mkha' reg pa zhes bya ba la nam mkha'i sgras ni gzugs mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa lus brjod do //
analyzed: nam mkha' reg pa zhes bya ba la nam mkha'i sgras ni gzugs mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa lus brjod do //
translated: The phrase “touching space” means that the form of the invisibility of form is expressed as the body.

original: de'i reg pas nam mkha'i reg pa ste reg rdo rje ma'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i reg pas nam mkha'i reg pa ste reg rdo rje ma'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The touching of that is the touching of space, which means the essence of the Vajra Touch.

original: mtshams @9b rnams kyis nges par grol ba zhes bya ba la mtshams ni gzugs dang yang dag par ldan pa'i ro ste /🔽de las nges par grol ba ni bsdus na 'gugs pa'i phyir mtshams rnams kyis nges par grol ba ni ro'o //
analyzed: mtshams @9b rnams kyis nges par grol ba zhes bya ba la mtshams ni gzugs dang yang dag par ldan pa'i ro ste / de las nges par grol ba ni bsdus na 'gugs pa'i phyir mtshams rnams kyis nges par grol ba ni ro'o //
translated: The phrase “liberated from the directions” means that the taste is associated with form.🔽Liberated from that is the taste, which is the taste that is drawn together in a condensed form.

original: de nyid ro rdo rje ma zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid ro rdo rje ma zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning of the phrase “liberated from the directions,” which means the Vajra Taste.

original: 'dis ni rjes su spyod pa lnga rab tu bstan to //🔽rdo rje sems dpa' dang zhes bya ba ni kun du bzang po ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni rjes su spyod pa lnga rab tu bstan to // rdo rje sems dpa' dang zhes bya ba ni kun du bzang po ste /
translated: This teaches the five modes of conduct.🔽The phrase “Vajrasattva” means Samantabhadra,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' ni de'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' ni de'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because Vajrasattva is a synonym for him.

original: rdo rje bstan pa snying po dang ldan pa la sems dpa' ni rang dang gzhan gyi don bya ba'i mtshan nyid bzang po ni dge ba gang la yod pa de rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bstan pa snying po dang ldan pa la sems dpa' ni rang dang gzhan gyi don bya ba'i mtshan nyid bzang po ni dge ba gang la yod pa de rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: Vajra-heartedness is the good nature of the one who has the essence of the Vajra Doctrine, which is the one who has the virtue of working for the benefit of self and others.

original: rdo rje snying po zhes bya ba ni sa'i snying pos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje snying po zhes bya ba ni sa'i snying pos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Vajra-essence is Kshitigarbha.

original: rdo rje ni don dam par stong pa sa'i khams kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni don dam par stong pa sa'i khams kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: Vajra is the ultimate, the essence of the earth element.

original: de yang yin la rdo rje'i yang yin te rdo rje'i snying po'o //
analyzed: de yang yin la rdo rje'i yang yin te rdo rje'i snying po'o //
translated: He is that, and he is also a vajra, so he is the vajra-essence.

original: rdo rje'i blo gros dang zhes bya ba ni 'jam dpal gyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje'i blo gros dang zhes bya ba ni 'jam dpal gyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Vajra-intellect is Manjushri.

original: rdo rje ltar rno ba'i blo gang la yod pa de ni rdo rje blo gros so//
analyzed: rdo rje ltar rno ba'i blo gang la yod pa de ni rdo rje blo gros so//
translated: He who has the intellect that is sharp like a vajra is the vajra-intellect.🔽Vajra-in-hand is Vajrapani.

original: phyag na rdo rje dang zhes bya ba ni rdo rje ni blang dor gyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid can lag na gang la yod de de phyag na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje dang zhes bya ba ni rdo rje ni blang dor gyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid can lag na gang la yod de de phyag na rdo rje'o //
translated: Vajra is the knowledge of what to adopt and what to reject. He who has it in his hand is Vajrapani.

original: rdo rje rgyal po dang zhe bya ba 'di ni rdo rje bzhin du bstan pa nyid kyis snying rje chen pos 'jig rten la phan pa'i phyir snang bas na /
analyzed: rdo rje rgyal po dang zhe bya ba 'di ni rdo rje bzhin du bstan pa nyid kyis snying rje chen pos 'jig rten la phan pa'i phyir snang bas na /
translated: The phrase “vajra king” means that he appears in the world out of great compassion, just like a vajra, in order to benefit the world.

original: rdo rjer gyal po ni 'jig rten dbang phyug go //🔽rdo rje dam tshig dang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i snying po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽rdo rje stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas rnam mkhar brjod do //
analyzed: rdo rjer gyal po ni 'jig rten dbang phyug go // rdo rje dam tshig dang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i snying po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // rdo rje stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas rnam mkhar brjod do //
translated: The one called “Vajra King” is the Lord of the World, because he appears for the sake of the world through great compassion, just like a vajra.🔽“Vajra Commitment” means Akashagarbha.

original: de la yang dag par 'gro bas na dam tshig ste rdo rje dam tshig go //
analyzed: de la yang dag par 'gro bas na dam tshig ste rdo rje dam tshig go //
translated: He is called “Vajra” because of the aspect of emptiness, and “Commitment” because of going to the real.

original: rdo rje chos dang zhes bya ba ni byams pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje chos dang zhes bya ba ni byams pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Vajra Dharma” means Maitreya.

original: rdo rje dang 'dra bar yid la re ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i chos ma 'ongs pa'i dus na ston pa'i phyir rdo rje'i chos so //
analyzed: rdo rje dang 'dra bar yid la re ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i chos ma 'ongs pa'i dus na ston pa'i phyir rdo rje'i chos so //
translated: He is called “Vajra Dharma” because he will teach the Dharma in the future, the Dharma that fulfills all wishes just like a vajra.

original: rdo rje longs spyod dang zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rdo rje longs spyod dang zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Vajra Enjoyment” means Sarvanivaranavishkambhin.

original: rdo rje ni stong pa'i rang bzhin nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje ni stong pa'i rang bzhin nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: The vajra is the nature of emptiness, the afflictions.

original: de rnams la yang dag pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin shes rab kyis longs spyod pa na bzlog pa gang la yod pa de ni rdo rje longs spyod do //
analyzed: de rnams la yang dag pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin shes rab kyis longs spyod pa na bzlog pa gang la yod pa de ni rdo rje longs spyod do //
translated: When one enjoys those with the wisdom that is the nature of the true path, that is Vajra-bhasa.

original: 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa'i ngo bo'i 'khor gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa'i ngo bo'i 'khor gsungs so //
translated: This states the retinue that is the nature of bodhisattvas.

original: rdo rje spyi bo zhes bya ba ni gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽rdo rje ltar phigs par dka' ba'i spyi bor gnas pa'i gtsug tor gang gi lag pa gnyis na @10a * //
analyzed: rdo rje spyi bo zhes bya ba ni gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to // rdo rje ltar phigs par dka' ba'i spyi bor gnas pa'i gtsug tor gang gi lag pa gnyis na @10a * //
translated: Vajra-musa means “crown protuberance chakravartin.”

original: yod pa de ni rdo rje spyi bo'o //
analyzed: yod pa de ni rdo rje spyi bo'o //
translated: The one who has a crown protuberance on the head that is difficult to penetrate like a vajra, and who has it in both hands, is Vajra-musa.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab mthar byed kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab mthar byed kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Subhuti-vikrintin means “Destroyer of Wisdom.”

original: de la rnam par gnon pa'i sgras ni gshin rje la brjod de /
analyzed: de la rnam par gnon pa'i sgras ni gshin rje la brjod de /
translated: Here, the word “vikrintin” refers to Yama.

original: shin tu yang yang dag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu yang yang dag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is because he is extremely correct.

original: de'i rnam par gnon pa ni gang gis gnon pa de rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par gnon pa ni gang gis gnon pa de rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa'o //
translated: His subjugation is the subjugation by that one, Subjugatory Power.

original: rnam rtog med pa'i spyi bo zhes bya ba ni shes rab mthar byed kyis so //
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa'i spyi bo zhes bya ba ni shes rab mthar byed kyis so //
translated: The one called “the head of non-conception” is the one who ends wisdom.

original: rnam rtog med pa'i sgras ni shes rab tu brjod do //
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa'i sgras ni shes rab tu brjod do //
translated: The word “non-conception” refers to wisdom.

original: des me ni me ste le lo 'joms par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des me ni me ste le lo 'joms par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That fire is the fire, because it conquers laziness.

original: rnam rtog med pa'i sgra zhes bya ba ni padma mthar byed do //
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa'i sgra zhes bya ba ni padma mthar byed do //
translated: The one called “the sound of non-conception” is the one who ends the lotus.

original: gtso bor 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyis mgos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bor 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyis mgos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is the head, because it is the chief of the afflictions of desire and so on.

original: brjed ngas pa bzlog pa nyid kyi phyir rnam rtog med pa'o //
analyzed: brjed ngas pa bzlog pa nyid kyi phyir rnam rtog med pa'o //
translated: It is non-conception, because it is the reversal of forgetfulness.

original: de yang yin la sgra yang yin te /
analyzed: de yang yin la sgra yang yin te /
translated: It is that, and it is a sound.

original: gang gi rnam par dag pa snang ba mtha' yas kyi rigs la gnas pa'i phyir rnam rtog med pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: gang gi rnam par dag pa snang ba mtha' yas kyi rigs la gnas pa'i phyir rnam rtog med pa'i sgra'o //
translated: The sound of non-conception is the one who ends the sound, because he is the one who abides in the family of Amitābha, whose nature is pure light.

original: rnam rtog med pa'i chos dang zhes bya ba ni bgegs mthar byed de /
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa'i chos dang zhes bya ba ni bgegs mthar byed de /
translated: The one called “the Dharma of non-conception” is the one who ends the obstructors.

original: gtso bor phrag dog la sogs pa rnams kyis rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po'i phyir rnam rtog med pa yang yin la chos kyang yin te /
analyzed: gtso bor phrag dog la sogs pa rnams kyis rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po'i phyir rnam rtog med pa yang yin la chos kyang yin te /
translated: It is also nonconceptual and a phenomenon, for the most part, as an antidote to the distraction of envy and so on.

original: bgegs la phur bus 'debs pas go cha'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir rnam rtog med pa'i chos so //
analyzed: bgegs la phur bus 'debs pas go cha'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir rnam rtog med pa'i chos so //
translated: It is also a non-conceptual dharma, because it is the essence of the armor, since one strikes the obstructors with the kīla.🔽The pledge of non-conceptuality

original: rnam rtog med pa'i dam tshig dang // zhes bya ba ni mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa'i dam tshig dang // zhes bya ba ni mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means “immovable.”

original: rims la sogs pa'i nad nye bar zhi bas ma dad pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzlog pa'i phyir rnam rtog med pa'o //
analyzed: rims la sogs pa'i nad nye bar zhi bas ma dad pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzlog pa'i phyir rnam rtog med pa'o //
translated: It is non-conceptual because it stops the concepts of lack of faith and so forth, since it pacifies the illnesses of contagious disease and so forth.

original: de yang yin la dam tshig kyang yin te /
analyzed: de yang yin la dam tshig kyang yin te /
translated: It is also a pledge,

original: nad la sogs pa nye bar zhi bas 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rnam rtog med pa'i dam tshig go //
analyzed: nad la sogs pa nye bar zhi bas 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rnam rtog med pa'i dam tshig go //
translated: because it is not to be transgressed, since it pacifies illnesses and so forth.🔽The vajra of joy

original: dga' ba rdo rje dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dga' ba rdo rje dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means the king of desire.

original: bgegs thams cad 'joms par byed pa nyid kyis le lo mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang pas sems la dga' ba thob pas dga' ba'o //
analyzed: bgegs thams cad 'joms par byed pa nyid kyis le lo mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang pas sems la dga' ba thob pas dga' ba'o //
translated: It is joy because it is the joy of the mind, which is obtained by abandoning the opposite of laziness, by the destruction of all obstacles.

original: de yang yin la rdo rje yang yin pas dga' ba'i rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de yang yin la rdo rje yang yin pas dga' ba'i rdo rje'o //
translated: And since it is that and also a vajra, it is the vajra of joy.🔽The vajra of supreme joy

original: rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje dang // zhes bya ba'i dbyug ba sngon po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje dang // zhes bya ba'i dbyug ba sngon po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: is the meaning of the word nīl̤a-danda.

original: 'jigs pa thams cad bzlog pa'i phyir khyad par du 'phags pa'i dga' ba bskyed pas rab tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad bzlog pa'i phyir khyad par du 'phags pa'i dga' ba bskyed pas rab tu dga' ba'o //
translated: It is supreme joy because it generates a special joy, in order to avert all fears.

original: de yang yin la rdo rje yang yin pas stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo'i phyir rab @10b tu dga' ba'i rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de yang yin la rdo rje yang yin pas stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo'i phyir rab @10b tu dga' ba'i rdo rje'o //
translated: And since it is that and also a vajra, it is the vajra of supreme joy, because of its nature of emptiness.🔽The vajra of passion

original: 'dod chags rdo rje dang zhes bya ba ni stobs po che zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod chags rdo rje dang zhes bya ba ni stobs po che zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: is the meaning of the word mahā-bala.

original: mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa'i nyes pa sel bas de kho na nyid kyi 'dod chags kyi 'dod chags so //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa'i nyes pa sel bas de kho na nyid kyi 'dod chags kyi 'dod chags so //
translated: It is passion because it is the passion of reality, by the removal of the faults of the dakinis, etc.

original: de yang yin la 'dod chags kyang yin pas 'dod chags rdo rje'o /
analyzed: de yang yin la 'dod chags kyang yin pas 'dod chags rdo rje'o /
translated: And since it is that and also passion, it is the vajra of passion.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i rdo rje dang // zhes bya ba ni gnod mdzes rgyal po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i rdo rje dang // zhes bya ba ni gnod mdzes rgyal po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means the one called the King of Wrathful Ones.

original: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dug gsal bar byed pas lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dug gsal bar byed pas lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: It is co-emergent because it is the essence of co-emergence, which clarifies the poisons of the animate and inanimate.

original: de yang yin la rdo rje yang yin pas lhan cig skyes pa'i rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de yang yin la rdo rje yang yin pas lhan cig skyes pa'i rdo rje'o //
translated: And it is a vajra, thus it is the co-emergent vajra.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni de'i rigs can rnams kyis so //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni de'i rigs can rnams kyis so //
translated: Moreover, means those of that family.

original: dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba ni grangs kyis gzhal bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba ni grangs kyis gzhal bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Incalculable means that they cannot be measured by number.🔽Those who have superior devotion to the Vajra Vehicle

original: rdo rje'i theg pa la lhag par mos pa'i zhes bya ba la rdo rje'i theg pa ni sngags kyi theg pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i theg pa la lhag par mos pa'i zhes bya ba la rdo rje'i theg pa ni sngags kyi theg pa'o //
translated: means the Mantra Vehicle.

original: ji skad du /🔽dkyil 'khor tshogs dang thab khung dang // gtor ma 'dus pa'i rim pa dang // de nyid rnam pa bdun du grags //
analyzed: ji skad du / dkyil 'khor tshogs dang thab khung dang // gtor ma 'dus pa'i rim pa dang // de nyid rnam pa bdun du grags //
translated: As it is said:🔽The mandala, the assembly, the hearth,🔽the rite of the sacrificial cake,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: and the seven realities are renowned.

original: de la lhag par mos pa ni dga' ba gang rnams la yod pa de ni rdo rje'i theg pa la lhag par mos pa ste de rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de la lhag par mos pa ni dga' ba gang rnams la yod pa de ni rdo rje'i theg pa la lhag par mos pa ste de rnams kyis so //
translated: Those who have that delight are devoted to the Vajra Vehicle.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngon bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngon bzhin no //
translated: The words bodhisattva and so forth are as before.

original: sngags kyi spyod pa la mos pa rnams dang thabs cig tu zhes bya ba ni lhan cig tu'o ;
analyzed: sngags kyi spyod pa la mos pa rnams dang thabs cig tu zhes bya ba ni lhan cig tu'o ;
translated: Together with those devoted to the practice of mantra means together with those who are devoted to the practice of mantra.

original: / bzhugs so zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: / bzhugs so zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: The words dwelt are connected with the previous action.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis kyis 'khor phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis kyis 'khor phun sum tshogs pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the excellent retinue in two ways,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis cho 'phrul bstan pa brjod pa'i phyir 'khor snod du byas pa'i yan lag ston pa'i gnas skabs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis cho 'phrul bstan pa brjod pa'i phyir 'khor snod du byas pa'i yan lag ston pa'i gnas skabs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: in order to explain the display of the Bhagavān, in order to show the other occasion of the teacher's state of making the retinue a suitable vessel,

original: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says then and so forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la bcom pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa bcom pa nyid dang / bdud bzhi bcom pa'i phyir dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la bcom pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa bcom pa nyid dang / bdud bzhi bcom pa'i phyir dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The Blessed One means that he is the Blessed One because he has destroyed attachment and so forth, because he has destroyed the four demons, and because he possesses the qualities of sovereignty and so forth.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo shin tu bskor ba zhes bya ba ni shin tu yang legs par gang gis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo shin tu bskor ba zhes bya ba ni shin tu yang legs par gang gis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'o //
translated: The one who has turned the wheel of Dharma well means that he is the one who has turned the wheel of Dharma well, very well.

original: yang na bde ba'i thabs 'dod pa'i yon tan rnam pa lnga la longs spyod pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bskor ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i rnam pa chos kyi 'khor lo rgyud sde @11a * //
analyzed: yang na bde ba'i thabs 'dod pa'i yon tan rnam pa lnga la longs spyod pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bskor ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i rnam pa chos kyi 'khor lo rgyud sde @11a * //
translated: Alternatively, the wheel of Dharma, which has the characteristic of enjoying the five types of sense objects that are the means of attaining bliss, is the wheel of Dharma that has the aspect of the antidote to the afflictions such as attachment. It is the one who has turned that wheel of Dharma well, very well, by teaching the five classes of tantra.

original: rnam pa lnga bstan pa'i mtshan nyid gang gis de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga bstan pa'i mtshan nyid gang gis de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is what it means to be called the one who has turned the wheel of Dharma well.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa ni shin tu mthar phyin ces bya ba ni shin tu yang legs par yongs su ni kun nas khams gsum na spyod pa'i sems can gyi dbye bas sam /🔽rnam pa lnga'i sems can gyi dbye bas so //🔽mthar phyin pa ni rab kyi mthar thug pa thob par byas pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa ni shin tu mthar phyin ces bya ba ni shin tu yang legs par yongs su ni kun nas khams gsum na spyod pa'i sems can gyi dbye bas sam / rnam pa lnga'i sems can gyi dbye bas so // mthar phyin pa ni rab kyi mthar thug pa thob par byas pa'o //
translated: The Buddha's work is extremely well completed.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa ni gang gis gzhan gyi don byed pa'i mtshan nyid can de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa ni gang gis gzhan gyi don byed pa'i mtshan nyid can de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The Buddha's work is that by which he accomplishes the aims of others.🔽The accumulations of merit and direct intuition are extremely well completed.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ni shin tu rdzogs pa ste zhes bya ba ni shin tu legs par rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi mtshan nyid can gang gis de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ni shin tu rdzogs pa ste zhes bya ba ni shin tu legs par rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi mtshan nyid can gang gis de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The accumulations of merit and direct intuition are extremely well completed in every way.

original: de la phyi'i pha rol tu phyin pa gsum sbyin pa'i mtshan nyid can bsod nams so //
analyzed: de la phyi'i pha rol tu phyin pa gsum sbyin pa'i mtshan nyid can bsod nams so //
translated: The three outer perfections, i.e. giving, morality and patience, are the accumulation of merit.

original: bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi mtshan nyid can ni ye shes so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi mtshan nyid can ni ye shes so //
translated: The characteristic of meditative concentration and wisdom is intuition.

original: brtson 'grus ni gnyis ka'i yan lag go //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni gnyis ka'i yan lag go //
translated: Exertion is the limb of both.

original: 'dir yang ting nge 'dzin ni gsum gyi skabs dang rim pa lnga rnams la yang ji srid par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dag gi bshad pa bla ma'i zhal nas rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang ting nge 'dzin ni gsum gyi skabs dang rim pa lnga rnams la yang ji srid par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dag gi bshad pa bla ma'i zhal nas rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Here also, meditative concentration is to be understood from the guru's instruction as the explanation of the accumulations of merit and intuition in the context of the three meditative stabilizations and the five stages.

original: 'khor de la zhes bya ba ni bsdus nas lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa can dang / rgyas par ni nam mkha'i ngo bo khyab par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor de la zhes bya ba ni bsdus nas lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa can dang / rgyas par ni nam mkha'i ngo bo khyab par gnas pa'o //
translated: The assembly is the form of the mandala of thirty-two deities, in brief, and of the deities pervading the essence of space, in detail.

original: zhal 'dzum pa dang bcas pas zhes bya ba ni zhal gyi padma rnam par phye ba ste /
analyzed: zhal 'dzum pa dang bcas pas zhes bya ba ni zhal gyi padma rnam par phye ba ste /
translated: With a smiling face means that the lotus of his face is fully opened,

original: 'chad bzhin pa'i chos 'phrul bstan pa'i dgongs pa mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chad bzhin pa'i chos 'phrul bstan pa'i dgongs pa mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has the intention to demonstrate the magic of the doctrine that will be explained.

original: bzhugs so zhes bya ba ni gnas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bzhugs so zhes bya ba ni gnas par gyur pa'o //
translated: He was dwelling means that he was abiding.

original: de ltar ston pa'i gnas skabs gzhan rab tu bstan nas 'od zer 'phros pas 'khor rnams snod du bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar ston pa'i gnas skabs gzhan rab tu bstan nas 'od zer 'phros pas 'khor rnams snod du bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught the occasion of the Teacher, in order to make the retinue a suitable vessel,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he spoke thus, “Then,” and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhal 'dzum pa'i mdzad pa'i rjes thogs su'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhal 'dzum pa'i mdzad pa'i rjes thogs su'o // bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
translated: “Then” means immediately after the Bhagavān’s smiling activity.

original: 'od zer gyi dra ba chen po bkye ste zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: 'od zer gyi dra ba chen po bkye ste zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: “Bhagavān” is as before, and is connected with “having emitted a great net of light rays.”

original: ye shes kyi rang bzhin can gyi 'od zer gyi tshogs spros par gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rang bzhin can gyi 'od zer gyi tshogs spros par gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that a mass of light rays having the nature of pristine consciousness was emitted.

original: gang las zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas //
analyzed: gang las zhe na / de'i phyir / ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas //
translated: From where?🔽Therefore it is said,

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: “from all the pores.”

original: don gyis bcom ldan 'das dang 'brel pa'i skul gnas pa las @11b so ;
analyzed: don gyis bcom ldan 'das dang 'brel pa'i skul gnas pa las @11b so ;
translated: The meaning is that it is connected with the Bhagavān’s body.

original: / ci zhig byas nas she na /
analyzed: / ci zhig byas nas she na /
translated: What did he do?

original: de'i phyir rdo rje phreng ba mngon par byang chub pa'i tshul zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rdo rje phreng ba mngon par byang chub pa'i tshul zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “having entered into the meditative concentration called the vajra-garland method of manifest enlightenment.

original: de la rdo rje phreng ba gtso bo dang btags pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rdo rje phreng ba gtso bo dang btags pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: ” Therein, the vajra-garland is twofold, by the division into principal and nominal.

original: rdo rje ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: The vajra is the clearlight nature of mind, which is to be attained by the stage of manifest enlightenment,

original: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud kyi dgongs pas so /
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud kyi dgongs pas so /
translated: according to the viewpoint of the Yoga Tantras.

original: rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi dgongs pas kyang don gyi lhan cig skyes pa nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi dgongs pas kyang don gyi lhan cig skyes pa nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: According to the viewpoint of the Yoginī Tantras, it is the experience of the ultimate innate joy.

original: gnyis ka ltar yang sa bcu gsum pa'i sa'i ngo bo ji skad du /
analyzed: gnyis ka ltar yang sa bcu gsum pa'i sa'i ngo bo ji skad du /
translated: According to both, it is the essence of the thirteenth stage, as it is said,

original: dang po'i las kyi sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: dang po'i las kyi sbyor ba yis //
translated: “By the application of the beginner,🔽one should attain the vajra-like concentration.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.🔽🔽

original: rdo rje phreng ba ni bag chags su gtogs pa rang bzhin gyi tshogs brgya dang drug cu 'gags pas stong pa dang shin tu stong pa dang / stong pa chen po'i mtshan nyid can gyi ye shes gsum nyams su myong ba'i rgyun no //
analyzed: rdo rje phreng ba ni bag chags su gtogs pa rang bzhin gyi tshogs brgya dang drug cu 'gags pas stong pa dang shin tu stong pa dang / stong pa chen po'i mtshan nyid can gyi ye shes gsum nyams su myong ba'i rgyun no //
translated: The Vajra Rosary is the continuum of the experience of the three intuitions, which are characterized by emptiness, great emptiness, and supreme emptiness, by the cessation of the one hundred and sixty natural instinctual propensities.

original: de nyid ni mngon par byang chub pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni mngon par byang chub pa ste /
translated: That itself is the manifest enlightenment,

original: gcig tu chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa thams cad zad par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa thams cad zad par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the single nature of the Reality Body, which causes the exhaustion of all conceptual thoughts.

original: de nyid ni tshul te ting nge 'dzin dang phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid can gyi thabs kyis de skad ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sems rtse gcig tu byed pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par la snyoms par zhugs nas so //
analyzed: de nyid ni tshul te ting nge 'dzin dang phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid can gyi thabs kyis de skad ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sems rtse gcig tu byed pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par la snyoms par zhugs nas so //
translated: That itself is the method, which is the state of meditative absorption in the samadhi called that, by means of the method characterized by samadhi and mudra.

original: gzhan gyi stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rdo rje phreng ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rdo rje phreng ba ste /
translated: The other is the Vajra Rosary of the intuition of emptiness.

original: de la stong pa nyid ni gsang ba'i rdo rje'i rtsa dang padma'i rtsa'o //
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid ni gsang ba'i rdo rje'i rtsa dang padma'i rtsa'o //
translated: There, emptiness is the secret vajra channel and the lotus channel.

original: ye shes de ni gnyis po yang dag par sbyar ba las thob par bya ba mchog kun rdzob kyi sems kyi rnam pa rdzas kyi thig le dang lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes de ni gnyis po yang dag par sbyar ba las thob par bya ba mchog kun rdzob kyi sems kyi rnam pa rdzas kyi thig le dang lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: That intuition is to be attained from the correct union of the two, the supreme, the aspect of conventional mind, which is the innate reality drop.

original: de nyid ni rdo rje ste rnam par rtog pa thams cad 'bigs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni rdo rje ste rnam par rtog pa thams cad 'bigs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself is the vajra, because it pierces all conceptual thoughts.

original: de'i phreng ba ni byang chub sems kyi rgyun no //
analyzed: de'i phreng ba ni byang chub sems kyi rgyun no //
translated: The garland of that is the stream of the spirit of enlightenment.

original: des thob par bya ba mngon par byang chub pa bde ba chen po'i mtshan nyid don dam pa'i bde ba'i rnam pa can no //
analyzed: des thob par bya ba mngon par byang chub pa bde ba chen po'i mtshan nyid don dam pa'i bde ba'i rnam pa can no //
translated: The attainment of that is the great bliss characterized by manifest enlightenment, which has the aspect of ultimate bliss.

original: de nyid ni tshul te mi slob pa'i lam la khyer bar byed pa'i thabs te de skad ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms bar zhugs nas zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni tshul te mi slob pa'i lam la khyer bar byed pa'i thabs te de skad ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms bar zhugs nas zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: That itself is the way, the means of carrying one to the path of no learning.

original: yang na rdo rje ni mi phyed pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: yang na rdo rje ni mi phyed pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Or else, the vajra is the indivisible intuition,

original: dbugs kyi rim pa mtshon par byed pa sngon du 'gro bas 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbugs kyi rim pa mtshon par byed pa sngon du 'gro bas 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accomplished by the prior indication of the process of the breath.

original: de'i phreng ba ni rgyun de dga' ba gsum skyed par byed pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phreng ba ni rgyun de dga' ba gsum skyed par byed pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Its garland is the cause of generating the three joys in that stream.

original: de nyid ni mngon par byang chub pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni mngon par byang chub pa ste /
translated: That itself is the manifest enlightenment,

original: rlung rnam par @12a * //
analyzed: rlung rnam par @12a * //
translated: because the wind,

original: rgyal bas ngag gi de kho na nyid mngon du byed pa'i phyir dang / byang chub kyi sems 'dzin nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyal bas ngag gi de kho na nyid mngon du byed pa'i phyir dang / byang chub kyi sems 'dzin nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: having become victorious, manifests the reality of speech and is able to hold the bodhicitta.

original: de nyid ni tshul te zhes bya ba ni sngon bzhin te /
analyzed: de nyid ni tshul te zhes bya ba ni sngon bzhin te /
translated: That itself is the way, as before,

original: de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / ji skad du /
analyzed: de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / ji skad du /
translated: and having entered into such a samādhi, is the meaning of “having entered into samādhi.”

original: le'u gsum pa 'chad par 'gyur ba las //🔽rdo rje phreng ba'i don nges pa //
analyzed: le'u gsum pa 'chad par 'gyur ba las // rdo rje phreng ba'i don nges pa //
translated: As will be explained in the third chapter,🔽the meaning of the Vajra Garland

original: rdo rje phreng ba zhes bya'i ming //
analyzed: rdo rje phreng ba zhes bya'i ming //
translated: is the name “Vajra Garland.”

original: de yang sa ni bcu gsum pa //
analyzed: de yang sa ni bcu gsum pa //
translated: That is also the thirteenth stage,

original: dga' ba bzhi pa don gyis gnas //
analyzed: dga' ba bzhi pa don gyis gnas //
translated: the abode of the meaning of the fourth joy.

original: thams cad stong nyid bde chen po //
analyzed: thams cad stong nyid bde chen po //
translated: It is the emptiness of everything, great bliss,

original: ngag gi spyod yul kun las 'das //
analyzed: ngag gi spyod yul kun las 'das //
translated: beyond all objects of speech,

original: gnyis pa thams cad rnam par spangs //
analyzed: gnyis pa thams cad rnam par spangs //
translated: free from all duality.

original: skal bzang rnal 'byor kun gyi mtha' //
analyzed: skal bzang rnal 'byor kun gyi mtha' //
translated: The end of all fortunate yogis.

original: rnal 'byor ma yi zhal gyi yul //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma yi zhal gyi yul //
translated: The object of the face of the yoginīs.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / yang de nyid las /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / yang de nyid las /
translated: And also in that very [text]:🔽The emptiness of vajra wisdom

original: rdo rje ye shes stong nyid dang // rdo rje phreng ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rdo rje ye shes stong nyid dang // rdo rje phreng ba zhes bshad do //
translated: Is explained as the vajra garland.

original: stong nyid rdo rje gsang pad rtsa //
analyzed: stong nyid rdo rje gsang pad rtsa //
translated: The secret lotus of emptiness vajra,🔽The supreme lord of the vajra realm,

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug mchog / ye shes mchog tu bde ba che //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug mchog / ye shes mchog tu bde ba che //
translated: The supreme wisdom of great bliss,

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo mtshar ba //🔽rdo rje de yang rnam rtog rnams //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo mtshar ba // rdo rje de yang rnam rtog rnams //
translated: The wonder of the connate.🔽That vajra is also well known

original: 'byed par byed pa yongs su grags //
analyzed: 'byed par byed pa yongs su grags //
translated: As the one that separates the concepts.

original: phreng ba de rnams kyi yang rgyun //
analyzed: phreng ba de rnams kyi yang rgyun //
translated: The garland is also the continuity of those,

original: byang chub sems kyi rdo rje rnams //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi rdo rje rnams //
translated: The vajras of bodhicitta.

original: de nas gzhan yang mnyan par gyis //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang mnyan par gyis //
translated: Then listen to something else:

original: rdo rje phreng ba'i don sdom pa //
analyzed: rdo rje phreng ba'i don sdom pa //
translated: The summary of the meaning of the vajra garland,

original: rgyud rnams kun du sbas pa ni //
analyzed: rgyud rnams kun du sbas pa ni //
translated: Which is hidden in all the tantras,

original: gang yang rung la brjod mi bya //
analyzed: gang yang rung la brjod mi bya //
translated: Should not be spoken to just anyone.

original: mi phyed pa ni rdo rjer gsungs //
analyzed: mi phyed pa ni rdo rjer gsungs //
translated: The indivisible is said to be the vajra,

original: de ni dbugs su yongs su grags //
analyzed: de ni dbugs su yongs su grags //
translated: And that is well known as the breath.

original: phreng ba rgyun ni mi 'chad pa //
analyzed: phreng ba rgyun ni mi 'chad pa //
translated: The garland is the uninterrupted continuity,

original: dga' ba rab bskyed bdag nyid can //
analyzed: dga' ba rab bskyed bdag nyid can //
translated: The nature of which is the generation of great joy.

original: rlung rnams kun la 'bigs byed pa //
analyzed: rlung rnams kun la 'bigs byed pa //
translated: He pierces all the winds.

original: rlung la 'bigs par mi nus so //
analyzed: rlung la 'bigs par mi nus so //
translated: But he cannot pierce the wind.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gzhan yang ci zhig byas nas she na ;
analyzed: gzhan yang ci zhig byas nas she na ;
translated: Moreover, what is done?

original: de phyir byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor rgya chen po rnams la gzigs nas zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de phyir byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor rgya chen po rnams la gzigs nas zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, having seen the great retinue of bodhisattvas, it is said.

original: grangs la sogs pa rnams kyis gzhal bar mi nus pa'i phyir rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: grangs la sogs pa rnams kyis gzhal bar mi nus pa'i phyir rgya chen po'o //
translated: It is great because it cannot be measured by number and so on.

original: chen po ni rin po che dang tsandan la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'khor ni tshogs kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: chen po ni rin po che dang tsandan la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'khor ni tshogs kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: The great retinue of bodhisattvas is the form of the assembly of jewels, sandalwood, and so on.

original: gzigs nas zhes bya ba ni bltas nas so //
analyzed: gzigs nas zhes bya ba ni bltas nas so //
translated: Having seen means having looked.

original: ci'i phyir 'od kyi dra ba chen po bkye zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'od kyi dra ba chen po bkye zhe na /
translated: Why did he emit the great net of light?

original: de'i phyir de dag snod du rung bar bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag snod du rung bar bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, in order to make them suitable vessels, it is said.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa lnga po rnams la'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa lnga po rnams la'o //
translated: For the five types of bodhisattvas.

original: snod du rung bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rdo rje phreng ba'i rgyud bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snod du rung bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rdo rje phreng ba'i rgyud bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to make them suitable vessels means in order to teach the Vajra Garland Tantra,

original: snod du @12b rung ba nyid bskyed pa'i don du'o /
analyzed: snod du @12b rung ba nyid bskyed pa'i don du'o /
translated: they generate suitability as a vessel.

original: gal te yang sgrib pa spangs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la snod du bya ba nyid mi dgos pa de lta na yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na slob dpon dang slob ma'i 'brel pa snod du rung ba bskyed pa sngon du 'gro ba brjod par 'dod pas
analyzed: gal te yang sgrib pa spangs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la snod du bya ba nyid mi dgos pa de lta na yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na slob dpon dang slob ma'i 'brel pa snod du rung ba bskyed pa sngon du 'gro ba brjod par 'dod pas
translated: Even though bodhisattvas who have abandoned obscurations do not need to be made into suitable vessels, still, in order to express the relationship of master and disciple in the future, which is preceded by the generation of suitability as a vessel,🔽the Bhagavān, for that purpose, emanates a great web of light rays from his pores.

original: / de'i phyir de gtsor gyur pa'i de rnams kyi snod du rung ba nyid ni skyon du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: / de'i phyir de gtsor gyur pa'i de rnams kyi snod du rung ba nyid ni skyon du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, their suitability as a vessel, which is foremost, is not a fault.

original: 'od zer gyi dra ba chen po des kyang zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ba spu'i bu gnas spros pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin 'od zer kha dog lnga pa'i tshogs kyis so //
analyzed: 'od zer gyi dra ba chen po des kyang zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ba spu'i bu gnas spros pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin 'od zer kha dog lnga pa'i tshogs kyis so //
translated: By that great web of light rays means by the collection of five colored light rays, the nature of the gnosis that emanates from the pores of the Bhagavān.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po de rnams la zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i khams khyab par gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po de rnams la zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i khams khyab par gnas pa rnams so //
translated: Those great bodhisattvas means those who abide pervading the realm of space.

original: reg pas zhes bya ba ni reg pa dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: reg pas zhes bya ba ni reg pa dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
translated: By contact means by being endowed with contact.

original: mchog tu dga' ba rjes su thob nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba rjes su thob nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having attained supreme joy means

original: sku la sogs pa 'bebs par sngon du 'gro bas rengs pa dang lha chen po dang 'phags pa'i dbyangs kyi gnas skabs nyams su myong ba sngon du 'gro ba 'od gsal sngon du byas pas nyon mongs pa spong ba rjes su thob pa'o //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa 'bebs par sngon du 'gro bas rengs pa dang lha chen po dang 'phags pa'i dbyangs kyi gnas skabs nyams su myong ba sngon du 'gro ba 'od gsal sngon du byas pas nyon mongs pa spong ba rjes su thob pa'o //
translated: having attained the abandonment of afflictions by way of the prior creation of luminosity, which is preceded by the descent of the bodhicitta into the crown and so on, and the experience of the states of the great seal, the exalted speech, and the exalted mind.

original: ji lta bu dang gang dang 'brel bas yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu dang gang dang 'brel bas yin zhe na /
translated: In what way and with what is it connected?

original: de'i phyir 'di lta ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di lta ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said, it is like this.

original: 'dra ba bstan ba'i phyir dpe bstan pa ni gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ji lta ba bzhin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dra ba bstan ba'i phyir dpe bstan pa ni gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ji lta ba bzhin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the similarity, the example is stated: Just like the Bhagavān Vajradhara, who is endowed with the yoga of nonduality.

original: phyi'i phyag rgya dang thabs snyoms par zhugs pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pas stong pa'i 'od gsal mngon du byed pa'i bcom ldan 'das rnam par rtog pa 'joms par byed pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi'i phyag rgya dang thabs snyoms par zhugs pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pas stong pa'i 'od gsal mngon du byed pa'i bcom ldan 'das rnam par rtog pa 'joms par byed pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term is: the Bhagavat, the Great Vajradhara, who is the conqueror of conceptualization, who manifests the clear light that is empty of the aspect of subject and object by means of the union with the external seal and the method.

original: da nas zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'od zer gyi dra ba'i sgo nas mchog tu dga' ba thob pa'i de ma thag tu'o //
analyzed: da nas zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'od zer gyi dra ba'i sgo nas mchog tu dga' ba thob pa'i de ma thag tu'o //
translated: Now means immediately after the attainment of supreme joy by means of the web of light rays of the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de rnams nyid //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de rnams nyid //
translated: Those very bodhisattvas

original: ces bya ba ni nam mkha'i gtos khyab pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni nam mkha'i gtos khyab pa nyid la'o //
translated: means pervading the entire vault of the sky.

original: de dag nyid tshim pa dang dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang zhes bya ba ni /🔽de la tshim pa ni rang bzhin gyi tshogs sum cu rtsa gsum spangs pas /
analyzed: de dag nyid tshim pa dang dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang zhes bya ba ni / de la tshim pa ni rang bzhin gyi tshogs sum cu rtsa gsum spangs pas /
translated: Those very ones are satisfied, delighted, and pleased

original: sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thabs la goms pas snang ba'i ye shes kyi bde ba 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thabs la goms pas snang ba'i ye shes kyi bde ba 'byung ba'o //
translated: . Therein, satisfaction is the arising of the bliss of the wisdom of appearance by means of the method that has the characteristic of the stage of mantra and seal through the abandonment of the thirty-three intrinsic heaps.

original: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi tshogs bzhi bcu spangs pas /🔽snang ba chod pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi tshogs bzhi bcu spangs pas / snang ba chod pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'o //
translated: The term joy refers to the arising of the pristine consciousness that cuts off appearances by abandoning the forty natural assemblies.

original: mgu ba zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi tshogs bdun spangs pas @13a * //
analyzed: mgu ba zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi tshogs bdun spangs pas @13a * //
translated: The term satisfaction refers to the arising of the pristine consciousness that obtains appearances by abandoning the seven natural assemblies.🔽The term delight refers to the pristine consciousness that obtains appearances by abandoning the seven natural assemblies.🔽The term contentment refers to the pristine consciousness that obtains appearances by abandoning the seven natural assemblies.🔽The term ecstasy refers to the pristine consciousness that obtains appearances by abandoning the seven natural assemblies.🔽The term delight refers to the pristine consciousness that obtains appearances by abandoning the seven natural assemblies.

original: snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes rab tu 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes rab tu 'byung ba'o //
translated: The term satisfaction refers to the pristine consciousness that obtains appearances by abandoning the seven natural assemblies.🔽The term contentment refers to the pristine consciousness that obtains appearances by abandoning the seven natural assemblies.🔽The term ecstasy refers to the pristine consciousness that obtains appearances by abandoning the seven natural assemblies.

original: tshim pa dang / dga' ba dang / mgu ba ni tshim pa dang / dga' ba dang / mgu ba ste des so //
analyzed: tshim pa dang / dga' ba dang / mgu ba ni tshim pa dang / dga' ba dang / mgu ba ste des so //
translated: The term delight refers to the pristine consciousness that obtains appearances by abandoning the seven natural assemblies.🔽The term satisfaction refers to the pristine consciousness that obtains appearances by abandoning the seven natural assemblies.🔽The term contentment refers to the pristine consciousness that obtains appearances by abandoning the seven natural assemblies.

original: brgyal bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal sngon du byas pa ma lus pa'i dbang po rnams kyi 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brgyal bar gyur to zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal sngon du byas pa ma lus pa'i dbang po rnams kyi 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The term ecstasy refers to the pristine consciousness that obtains appearances by abandoning the seven natural assemblies.🔽The term delight refers to the pristine consciousness that obtains appearances by abandoning the seven natural assemblies.🔽The term satisfaction refers to the pristine consciousness that obtains appearances by abandoning the seven natural assemblies.🔽The term contentment refers to the pristine consciousness that obtains appearances by abandoning the seven natural assemblies.🔽The term ecstasy refers to the pristine consciousness that obtains appearances by abandoning the seven natural assemblies.🔽The term delight refers to the pristine consciousness that obtains appearances by abandoning the seven natural assemblies.🔽The term satisfaction refers to the pristine consciousness that obtains appearances by abandoning the seven natural assemblies.🔽The term contentment refers to the pristine consciousness that obtains appearances by abandoning the seven natural assemblies.🔽The term ecstasy refers to the pristine consciousness that obtains appearances by abandoning the seven natural assemblies.

original: de ltar 'od zer spros pas 'khor snod du bya ba'i ngo bo mngon du brjod nas /🔽'od zer gyi dra ba nye bar bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyir de nas yang de'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar 'od zer spros pas 'khor snod du bya ba'i ngo bo mngon du brjod nas / 'od zer gyi dra ba nye bar bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyir de nas yang de'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The term delight refers to the pristine consciousness that obtains appearances by abandoning the seven natural assemblies.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
translated: The term satisfaction refers to the pristine consciousness

original: 'od zer gyi dra ba chen po de zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi 'od zer gyi tshogs chen po gang gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la reg pas mchog tu dga' ba thob par gyur pa'i 'od zer gyi dra ba chen po de'o //
analyzed: 'od zer gyi dra ba chen po de zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi 'od zer gyi tshogs chen po gang gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la reg pas mchog tu dga' ba thob par gyur pa'i 'od zer gyi dra ba chen po de'o //
translated: That great net of light rays means that great collection of light rays which is the nature of pristine consciousness, by which light rays the bodhisattvas attain supreme joy.

original: mdzod spur zhes bya ba ni smin ma'i dbus su'o //
analyzed: mdzod spur zhes bya ba ni smin ma'i dbus su'o //
translated: The ūrṇā means in the middle of the eyebrows.

original: bsdus par gyur to zhes bya ba ni zhugs par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: bsdus par gyur to zhes bya ba ni zhugs par gyur pa ste /
translated: It gathered means it entered.

original: 'od zer gyi dra ba'i bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od zer gyi dra ba'i bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the function of the net of light rays is complete.

original: nye bar bsdus pa de yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nye bar bsdus pa de yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That gathering also means

original: smin mtshams kyi dbus su zhugs par byas par 'gyur ba'o //
