analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the sixteenth question about the field.🔽How many are there of the previously mentioned channels?

original: sngon du gsungs pa'i rtsa rnams ji tsam zhes bya ba ni gtso bo'i 'khor lo la brten nas grangs ji tsam pa de'i phyir de'i yul la dri ba bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: sngon du gsungs pa'i rtsa rnams ji tsam zhes bya ba ni gtso bo'i 'khor lo la brten nas grangs ji tsam pa de'i phyir de'i yul la dri ba bcu drug pa'o //
translated: How many are there in dependence on the principal wheel?

original: ji ltar 'chad par 'gyur ba yi //🔽rnal 'byor lus la bde chen po'i //
analyzed: ji ltar 'chad par 'gyur ba yi // rnal 'byor lus la bde chen po'i //
translated: As will be explained,🔽in the yogin's body,🔽the channels of the wheel of great bliss

original: 'khor lo'i rtsa ni sum cu gnyis //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i rtsa ni sum cu gnyis //
translated: are thirty-two.

original: byang chub sems ni gsal 'bab pa'i //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni gsal 'bab pa'i //
translated: The channels through which the clear bodhicitta flows

original: rtsa rnams yang dag bshad par bya //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa rnams yang dag bshad par bya // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: will be properly explained.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs sogs skad cig / ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs sogs skad cig / ces bya ba ni /
translated: The moment of various kinds, and so on,

original: ji ltar rnam pa sna tshogs dang / rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par nyed pa dang / mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i skad cig ma rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba byang chub sems 'bab pa rnal 'byor pa'i lus la gnas pa /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa sna tshogs dang / rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par nyed pa dang / mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i skad cig ma rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba byang chub sems 'bab pa rnal 'byor pa'i lus la gnas pa /
translated: means that the divisions of the moments of various kinds, of maturation, of dissolution, and of the absence of characteristics, of the bodhicitta flowing in the channels, abide in the yogin's body.

original: de rnams kyi nyams su myong ba bskyed pa'i rim pa gsal ba'i phyir de'i rjes la rnam pa sna tshogs pa la sogs pa'i dri ba ni bcu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi nyams su myong ba bskyed pa'i rim pa gsal ba'i phyir de'i rjes la rnam pa sna tshogs pa la sogs pa'i dri ba ni bcu bdun pa'o //
translated: In order to clarify the stages of generating the experience of those, the seventeenth question is about the various aspects and so forth.

original: ji skad 'chad par 'gyur ba yi //
analyzed: ji skad 'chad par 'gyur ba yi //
translated: As will be explained:

original: rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par smin //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par smin //
translated: The various aspects, the ripening,

original: rnam par nyed dang mtshan nyid bral //
analyzed: rnam par nyed dang mtshan nyid bral //
translated: The vanishing, the freedom from characteristics,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so forth.

original: dga' ba dang zhes bya ba dang / dga' ba bzhi la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa la sogs pa'i skad cig ma rnams nyams su myong ba sngon du 'gro bas de rnams nyams su myong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dga' ba dang zhes bya ba dang / dga' ba bzhi la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa la sogs pa'i skad cig ma rnams nyams su myong ba sngon du 'gro bas de rnams nyams su myong ba'i phyir /
translated: The various aspects and so forth are the moments of the four joys and so forth, which are preceded by experience. In order to experience those,

original: de'i rjes la dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba'i yul la dri ba ni bco brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba'i yul la dri ba ni bco brgyad pa'o //
translated: the eighteenth question is about the classification of the objects of joy and so forth.

original: ji skad 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
analyzed: ji skad 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
translated: As will be explained:

original: dga' ba bde ba dang po ste //
analyzed: dga' ba bde ba dang po ste //
translated: Joy is the first bliss,

original: mchog tu dga' ba gnyis pa dang // dga' bral zhes bya gsum pa dang // bzhi pa lhan cig skyes par bshad //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba gnyis pa dang // dga' bral zhes bya gsum pa dang // bzhi pa lhan cig skyes par bshad //
translated: The second is supreme joy, the third is called “free from joy,” and the fourth is said to be innate.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: rdzas dang ni /
analyzed: rdzas dang ni /
translated: Substance,

original: sngags dang rlung dang thig le @24b zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngags dang rlung dang thig le @24b zhes bya ba ni /
translated: mantra, wind, and drop.

original: dri ba bcu pa'i rlung gi de kho na nyid ces bya ba la rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas rnam par dbye ba bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dri ba bcu pa'i rlung gi de kho na nyid ces bya ba la rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas rnam par dbye ba bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In the question on the reality of the wind, following the yoginī tantras, in order to make a division,

original: de'i lhag mar gyur pa thig le gsum bsgom pa'i yul la dri ba ni bcu dgu pa'o //
analyzed: de'i lhag mar gyur pa thig le gsum bsgom pa'i yul la dri ba ni bcu dgu pa'o //
translated: the remainder of that, the meditation on the three drops, is the question on the object of meditation, the nineteenth.

original: ji skad 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
analyzed: ji skad 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
translated: As will be explained:

original: rtsa rnams kun du 'bab pa dang // byang chub sems ni brten byas pa //
analyzed: rtsa rnams kun du 'bab pa dang // byang chub sems ni brten byas pa //
translated: The descent into all the channels, and the stabilization of bodhicitta,

original: rdo rje'i rtse dang padma'i rtser //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rtse dang padma'i rtser //
translated: at the tip of the vajra and the tip of the lotus,

original: rlung ni gzung bar bya ba ste //
analyzed: rlung ni gzung bar bya ba ste //
translated: the wind is to be held.

original: rkan la rtogs pa'i sbyor ba dang // kshm'im sngags kyi ni sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: rkan la rtogs pa'i sbyor ba dang // kshm'im sngags kyi ni sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the yoga of realization at the palate, and by the yoga of the mantra of kṣa,

original: rnal 'byor mchog ni thob par byed //
analyzed: rnal 'byor mchog ni thob par byed //
translated: the supreme yoga is attained.

original: bde ba kun gyi gzhi yi mchog //
analyzed: bde ba kun gyi gzhi yi mchog //
translated: The supreme basis of all bliss.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: yi ge gsum gyi ming ci zhe na /
analyzed: yi ge gsum gyi ming ci zhe na /
translated: What is the name of the three syllables?

original: rnal 'byor ma yi rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma yi rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas /
translated: Following the Yoginī Tantras,

original: sngags kyi de kho na nyid kyi bdag nyid can gyi yi ge gsum gyi ngo bo'i ming la ci zhes bya ba de'i yul la dri ba ni nyi shu pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi de kho na nyid kyi bdag nyid can gyi yi ge gsum gyi ngo bo'i ming la ci zhes bya ba de'i yul la dri ba ni nyi shu pa'o //
translated: the question about the object of the name of the three syllables that have the nature of the reality of mantra is the twentieth.

original: ji skad 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
analyzed: ji skad 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
translated: As will be explained:

original: yi ge gsum ni sku gsung thugs //
analyzed: yi ge gsum ni sku gsung thugs //
translated: The three syllables are body, speech, and mind.🔽Listen to the analysis of the essence.

original: snying po phye ba khyod nyon cig / de ni rnam par phye ste nyon //🔽aom ni sku yi rdo rje yi //
analyzed: snying po phye ba khyod nyon cig / de ni rnam par phye ste nyon // aom ni sku yi rdo rje yi //
translated: Listen to that analysis.

original: snying po nyid du yang dag bshad //
analyzed: snying po nyid du yang dag bshad //
translated: Om is rightly explained as the essence of the vajra body.

original: aa yi yi ge ao yig dang // ma yi yi ge zhes bya gsum //
analyzed: aa yi yi ge ao yig dang // ma yi yi ge zhes bya gsum //
translated: The three syllables are the syllable a, the syllable o, and the syllable ma.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽de nyid gsum zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // de nyid gsum zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And so on.🔽What is the nature of the three realities?

original: de nyid gsum ji lta bu zhen zhes bya bas de nyid gsum gyi yul dri ba ni nyi shu rtsa gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsum ji lta bu zhen zhes bya bas de nyid gsum gyi yul dri ba ni nyi shu rtsa gcig pa'o //
translated: The question about the object of the three realities is the twenty-first.

original: de rnams kyang bdag dang ye shes dang sngags kyi de kho na nyid rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams kyang bdag dang ye shes dang sngags kyi de kho na nyid rnams so //
translated: Those are the realities of the self, the intuition, and the mantra.

original: ji skad 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
analyzed: ji skad 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
translated: As will be explained:

original: bdag gi de nyid rnal 'byor mchog / rdo rje sems dpa' nyid kyi rgyud //
analyzed: bdag gi de nyid rnal 'byor mchog / rdo rje sems dpa' nyid kyi rgyud //
translated: The reality of the self is the supreme yoga, the tantra of Vajrasattva himself.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so forth.

original: de bzhin sna yi rtse mo gsum //
analyzed: de bzhin sna yi rtse mo gsum //
translated: The three nose-tips

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means

original: rlung gi de kho na nyid sngar mdor bstan pa'i rten du gyur pa rdzas dang sngags dang 'od zer gyi theg le'i rten du gyur ba'i sngon du bcu pa gsungs pa'i lhag ma dri ba ni nyi shu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: rlung gi de kho na nyid sngar mdor bstan pa'i rten du gyur pa rdzas dang sngags dang 'od zer gyi theg le'i rten du gyur ba'i sngon du bcu pa gsungs pa'i lhag ma dri ba ni nyi shu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: the twenty-two remaining questions, which are the basis of the wind reality, the basis of the substance, mantra, and light-ray yoga, and the basis of the ten previously summarized, as stated in the Ten Principles.

original: ji skad du 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
analyzed: ji skad du 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
translated: As will be explained:

original: gsang ba snying ga gdong sna'i ming //
analyzed: gsang ba snying ga gdong sna'i ming //
translated: The secret, the heart, the face, and the nose,🔽are the three places,

original: gsum pa'i rgyud las gsal ba ni ;🔽/'khor lo gsum gyi dbye ba ni //
analyzed: gsum pa'i rgyud las gsal ba ni ; /'khor lo gsum gyi dbye ba ni //
translated: as stated in the Tantra of the Three Places.

original: rnal 'byor pa yis bsgom pa'i rim //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yis bsgom pa'i rim //
translated: The three wheels are the stages of meditation by the yogi.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so forth.

original: lus kyi stong nyid ye shes dang // zhes bya ba ni /🔽rnal 'byor ba'i lus rtsa sna tshogs pa'i rten nyid kyi ye shes kyi rtsa dbus ma aa ba dh'u t'i ma byang chub kyi sems kyis rab @25a * //
analyzed: lus kyi stong nyid ye shes dang // zhes bya ba ni / rnal 'byor ba'i lus rtsa sna tshogs pa'i rten nyid kyi ye shes kyi rtsa dbus ma aa ba dh'u t'i ma byang chub kyi sems kyis rab @25a * //
translated: The intuition of the voidness of the body.

original: tu gang ba'i bdag nyid can sna'i rtse mo gsum pa thig le rnam pa gsum bzung ba'i 'bras bur gyur pa ji lta bu yin zhes bya ba sna rtse gsum gyi lhag mar gyur pa dri ba nyi shu rtsa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: tu gang ba'i bdag nyid can sna'i rtse mo gsum pa thig le rnam pa gsum bzung ba'i 'bras bur gyur pa ji lta bu yin zhes bya ba sna rtse gsum gyi lhag mar gyur pa dri ba nyi shu rtsa gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the twenty-third question, the remainder of the question about the three nose-tips: “What is the result of the retention of the three-featured drop at the tip of the nose, the nature of which is filled with the bodhicitta of the central channel, the intuition channel, the very basis of the various channels of the yogin’s body?”

original: ji skad 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
analyzed: ji skad 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
translated: As will be explained:

original: chos rnams thams cad snang ba med //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad snang ba med //
translated: All things are non-apparent,

original: mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du 'dod //
translated: and are held to be void of characteristics.

original: ces bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: ces bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: gang phyir aa ba dh'u t'ir zhugs //
analyzed: gang phyir aa ba dh'u t'ir zhugs //
translated: Because it enters the avadhūtī,

original: yang dag stong pa nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: yang dag stong pa nyid du 'dod //
translated: it is held to be perfect voidness.

original: ces bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: ces bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: de la ye shes bde ba che //
analyzed: de la ye shes bde ba che //
translated: Therein, the intuition of great bliss

original: byang chub sems kyis gang ba nyid //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyis gang ba nyid //
translated: is filled with bodhicitta.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: lha rnams kyang ji ltar gnas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lha rnams kyang ji ltar gnas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: How do the gods abide?

original: rnal 'byor pa'i lus de nyid la lha rnams rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i lus de nyid la lha rnams rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas /
translated: The gods are complete in the yogi's body, following the completion stage.

original: 'khor lo bzhi'i rang bzhin rtsa rnams kyi ngo bo thim pa dang / longs spyod pa dang bdag po sngon du gsungs pa'i bcu drug par /🔽rnal 'byor lus la rtsa rnams gang //
analyzed: 'khor lo bzhi'i rang bzhin rtsa rnams kyi ngo bo thim pa dang / longs spyod pa dang bdag po sngon du gsungs pa'i bcu drug par / rnal 'byor lus la rtsa rnams gang //
translated: The dissolution of the nature of the four wheels, the essence of the channels, and the enjoyment and lord mentioned previously,🔽are the remaining questions in the twenty-fourth

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lhag mar gyur pa dri ba ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lhag mar gyur pa dri ba ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa'o //
translated: verse, beginning with What are the channels in the yogi's body?

original: ji skad 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
analyzed: ji skad 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
translated: As will be explained:🔽The dharma, enjoyment, and great bliss

original: chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang // bde ba chen po yang dag brten //
analyzed: chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang // bde ba chen po yang dag brten //
translated: are perfectly present.

original: 'khor lo gzhan yang gang bshad pa //
analyzed: 'khor lo gzhan yang gang bshad pa //
translated: The other wheels that are explained

original: rim pa ji bzhin ma lus pa //
analyzed: rim pa ji bzhin ma lus pa //
translated: are all present in the same way.

original: de la rtag tu yang dag bzhugs//
analyzed: de la rtag tu yang dag bzhugs//
translated: They always perfectly abide.

original: thim  dang longs spyod bdag po ni //
analyzed: thim  dang longs spyod bdag po ni //
translated: Dissolution, enjoyment, and the lord

original: lha nyid mchog tu gnyis su med //
analyzed: lha nyid mchog tu gnyis su med //
translated: are the supreme deity, nondual.

original: yang dag ngo bo go 'phang brten //
analyzed: yang dag ngo bo go 'phang brten //
translated: The state of the perfect nature is supported.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de rnams kyi ming gang zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams kyi ming gang zhe na /
translated: What are their names?

original: de'i phyir de rnams kyi ming ni gang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams kyi ming ni gang zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “What are their names?”

original: de rnams ni lha ste ming ni ming du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni lha ste ming ni ming du gyur pa'o //
translated: They are the gods, and the names are the names.

original: gang zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi le'u'i lhag mar gyur pa dri ba nyi shur tsa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi le'u'i lhag mar gyur pa dri ba nyi shur tsa lnga pa'o //
translated: “What” is the twenty-fifth question, which is a remainder from the previous chapter.

original: ji skad du 'chad par 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'chad par 'gyur ba las /
translated: As will be explained,

original: de nas gzhan yang lha mo yi //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang lha mo yi //
translated: “Then, moreover, the goddess

original: de rnams kun gyi ming bshad bya //🔽'khor lo bzhi yid bye ba yis //
analyzed: de rnams kun gyi ming bshad bya // 'khor lo bzhi yid bye ba yis //
translated: explains the names of all of them.🔽By the enumeration of the nāḍīs of the four wheels,

original: rtsa yi rnam pa'i grangs kyis kyang //
analyzed: rtsa yi rnam pa'i grangs kyis kyang //
translated: with ten million,

original: las dang rdo rje de bzhin pad //
analyzed: las dang rdo rje de bzhin pad //
translated: the actions, the vajra, and likewise the lotus,

original: 'khor lo rnams kyi dbye ba yis //🔽rigs bzhi yi ni dbye ba dang // rtsa yi rim pas yang dag bzhugs //
analyzed: 'khor lo rnams kyi dbye ba yis // rigs bzhi yi ni dbye ba dang // rtsa yi rim pas yang dag bzhugs //
translated: are the divisions of the wheels.🔽The divisions of the four families

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: are correctly situated in the stages of the nāḍīs.”

original: gang du 'char ba dang ni nub //🔽ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang du 'char ba dang ni nub //🔽ces bya ba ni /
translated: Where do they rise and set?

original: rtsa'i rang bzhin gyi lha de rnams kyi 'char ba ni rab tu sad pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa'i rang bzhin gyi lha de rnams kyi 'char ba ni rab tu sad pa'o //
translated: The arising of those deities who are the nature of the channels is the full awakening.

original: nub pa ni nang du thim pa'o //
analyzed: nub pa ni nang du thim pa'o //
translated: The setting is the dissolution into the inner.

original: de dag ji ltar zhes sngon gyi dri ba'i lhag mar gyur ba ni @25b dri pa nyi shu rtsa drug pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar zhes sngon gyi dri ba'i lhag mar gyur ba ni @25b dri pa nyi shu rtsa drug pa'o //
translated: How those are is the remainder of the previous question, which is the twenty-sixth question.

original: ji skad du 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
analyzed: ji skad du 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
translated: As will be explained:

original: de nas gzhan yang rab bshad bya //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang rab bshad bya //
translated: Now, moreover, I will explain

original: 'char dang nub pa'i mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: 'char dang nub pa'i mtshan nyid ni //
translated: the characteristics of arising and setting,

original: rtsa rnams kyi ni rnal 'byor mchog / dngos grub thams cad kyi ni gnas //🔽mdun na gnas pa'i yul rnams la //
analyzed: rtsa rnams kyi ni rnal 'byor mchog / dngos grub thams cad kyi ni gnas // mdun na gnas pa'i yul rnams la //
translated: the supreme yoga of the channels, the abode of all powers.🔽The mental activity with respect to objects that are present in front

original: yid la byed pa der ni 'gro ;
analyzed: yid la byed pa der ni 'gro ;
translated: goes there.

original: / dbus ni nang du 'dus pa yin //
analyzed: / dbus ni nang du 'dus pa yin //
translated: The middle is the gathering within,

original: de tshe dbang po rab rgyas 'gyur //
analyzed: de tshe dbang po rab rgyas 'gyur //
translated: at which time the faculties are fully expanded.

original: de yis de rnams rab bskul bas //
analyzed: de yis de rnams rab bskul bas //
translated: By that, they are fully aroused,

original: de rnams rtsa la rim bzhin gnas //
analyzed: de rnams rtsa la rim bzhin gnas //
translated: and they abide in the channels in sequence.

original: de yis rab tu sad byas nas //
analyzed: de yis rab tu sad byas nas //
translated: By that, they are fully awakened,

original: lha mo rang rang 'khor lo la //
analyzed: lha mo rang rang 'khor lo la //
translated: and the goddesses in their own wheels

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so forth.

original: ji ltar mgon pos dga' ba rnams //
analyzed: ji ltar mgon pos dga' ba rnams //
translated: How are the joys of the lord?

original: skye ba'i rim pa gsal bar gsungs //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skye ba'i rim pa gsal bar gsungs // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The stages of birth are clearly taught.

original: sngon du bstan pa'i dri ba bco brgyad pa'i las dga' ba rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi lhag mar gyur pa rgyud gzhan du yang dag par bsgrags pa de'i yul la dri ba nyi shu rtsa bdun pa'o//
analyzed: sngon du bstan pa'i dri ba bco brgyad pa'i las dga' ba rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi lhag mar gyur pa rgyud gzhan du yang dag par bsgrags pa de'i yul la dri ba nyi shu rtsa bdun pa'o//
translated: This is the twenty-seventh question about the object of the remainder that has the characteristic of the separation of joy, the function of the eighteen previously explained, which is proclaimed in other tantras.

original: ji ltar 'chad par 'gyur ba las //🔽de nas gzhan yang bshad kyis nyon //
analyzed: ji ltar 'chad par 'gyur ba las // de nas gzhan yang bshad kyis nyon //
translated: As will be explained:

original: dga' ba bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: dga' ba bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid ni //
translated: “Now listen to the explanation of the characteristics of the generation of joy,

original: gang gis yang dag shes pa ni //
analyzed: gang gis yang dag shes pa ni //

analyzed: sngar bshad rtsa rnams rtag tu ni //

analyzed: rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis gtso bor gyur pa'i rtsa de rnams na khams kyi rang bzhin ji lta bu 'bab ces de'i yul la dri ba nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa'o //

analyzed: rdo rje bstan pa'i lus kyis ni //

analyzed: nges par de nyid bshad kyis nyon //

analyzed: bde ba thams cad rab tu 'phel //

analyzed: gtso bo nyid du ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: become the principal ones?

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis po de rnams kyi dbus su mtshams kyi rtsa gsum rtsa ba'i rgyud @26a * // chen por rgyu mtshan gang gis bstan zhes de'i yul la dri ba nyi shu dgu pa'o //

original: ji skad 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
analyzed: ji skad 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
translated: Now, what is the reason for teaching the three junction nāḍīs in the middle of those seventy-two thousand [nāḍīs] in the great root tantra?

analyzed: de nas gzhan yang bshad kyis nyon //

analyzed: mtshams kyi rtsa ni gtso bo nyid //

analyzed: rtsa rnams sdom dang 'char ba dang // gang gis shes nas rtag tu ni //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

analyzed: sngon du bstan pa'i dri ba bcu pa'i lan rgyas par bshad par gyur pa bskyed pa'i ngo bo 'khor bar 'khor ba'i gnas skabs su rlung rnams ji ltar thim pas ni 'jig par ji ltar 'gyur zhes de'i yul la dri ba ni sum cu pa dang sum cu
translated: The thirty-first and thirty-second chapters

analyzed: rtsa gcig pa'o //

analyzed: ji skad du 'chad par 'gyur pa la //
translated: As will be explained:

analyzed: bag chags nyon mongs can gyi yid //

analyzed: rlung gi ngo bos gzugs gzhan byed //

original: don ni nges par yod mi shes //
analyzed: don ni nges par yod mi shes //

analyzed: rlung tsam gcig tu rmongs pa yis //
translated: Confused by the vāyu alone,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: How is the principal one attained?

original: rtsa de rnams kyi bsdu ba'i mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya ba ni rtsa'i ngo bo la dmigs pa /
analyzed: rtsa de rnams kyi bsdu ba'i mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya ba ni rtsa'i ngo bo la dmigs pa /

analyzed: sdud par byed pa ji ltar thob par bya thabs gang gis rtogs par bya zhes de'i yul la dri ba ni sum cu rtsa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The thirty-second question is about the object of that, “How is it to be attained? By what means is it to be realized?”

original: ji skad du 'chad par 'gyur pa las //
analyzed: ji skad du 'chad par 'gyur pa las //
translated: As will be explained:

original: de nas gzhan yang bshad kyis nyon //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang bshad kyis nyon //
translated: “Now listen to another explanation.

original: ye shes chen po mchog chen po //
analyzed: ye shes chen po mchog chen po //
translated: The great wisdom, the great supreme,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: rnam rtog rlung ni rnam 'byed pa //
analyzed: rnam rtog rlung ni rnam 'byed pa //
translated: The wind of conceptualization is differentiated.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is

analyzed: ji ltar thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: “How is it to be attained?” is the remainder.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rlung rnams kyi grangs ni brgya rtsa brgyad kyi grangs can rnam par 'byed pa'i ngo bo sngon du gsungs pa'i bcu gsum pa'i lhag ma dri ba nyi shu rtsa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rlung rnams kyi grangs ni brgya rtsa brgyad kyi grangs can rnam par 'byed pa'i ngo bo sngon du gsungs pa'i bcu gsum pa'i lhag ma dri ba nyi shu rtsa gsum pa'o //
translated: The number of the winds of conceptualization is one hundred and eight. The essence of differentiation is the remainder of the thirteenth previously mentioned. The twenty-third question is

original: gang gi phyir bskyed pa'i rim ba sgom pa sngon du 'gro bas rdo rje bzlas pa'i ngo bo bdun du bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bskyed pa'i rim ba sgom pa sngon du 'gro bas rdo rje bzlas pa'i ngo bo bdun du bstan par bya ste /
translated: Since the generation stage is preliminary, the vajra recitation is to be explained in seven topics.

original: de nas gzhan yang bshad kyis nyon //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang bshad kyis nyon //
translated: “Now listen to another explanation.

original: rnam rtog rlung ni rnam gcod pa //
analyzed: rnam rtog rlung ni rnam gcod pa //
translated: The wind of discursive thought is cut off.

original: nyin dang mtshan du nges par ni //
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan du nges par ni //
translated: Day and night,

original: brgya dang brgyad kyis lhag par 'gyur //
analyzed: brgya dang brgyad kyis lhag par 'gyur //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

original: ma ning gi bzlas pa'i gnas skabs kyi cho ga can no //
analyzed: ma ning gi bzlas pa'i gnas skabs kyi cho ga can no //

original: de yang dag gi rnam par rtog pa 'joms par byed pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'char ba'o //
analyzed: de yang dag gi rnam par rtog pa 'joms par byed pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'char ba'o //
translated: Moreover, it is the arising of discursive thought because it destroys the conception of reality.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i lhag mar gyur pa'i dri ba @26b sum cu rtsa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i lhag mar gyur pa'i dri ba @26b sum cu rtsa bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the thirty-fourth question concerning the remainder of vajra recitation.

original: ji skad du 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
analyzed: ji skad du 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
translated: As will be explained:

original: de nas gzhan yang bshad kyis nyon //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang bshad kyis nyon //
translated: “Now listen to another explanation.

original: rnam rtog med pa'i rlung shar ba //
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa'i rlung shar ba //
translated: The wind of non-discursive thought arises.

original: gang shes rdo rje sems dpa' ni //
analyzed: gang shes rdo rje sems dpa' ni //

original: rang ngos go 'phang bzang po thob //
analyzed: rang ngos go 'phang bzang po thob //
translated: attaining the excellent stage of self-nature.

original: rtog pa med pa'i rlung chen mo //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i rlung chen mo //

original: gnyis pa thams cad rnam par spangs //
analyzed: gnyis pa thams cad rnam par spangs //

original: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin bdag / bsgom dang sgom pa min par bral //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin bdag / bsgom dang sgom pa min par bral //
translated: The nature of all things is free from meditation and non-meditation.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.🔽How do the channels not decline?

original: rtsa rnams ji ltar nub pa dang // zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo bzhi'am 'khor lo drug la gnas pa'i rtsa rnams ji ltar mi nub par 'gyur zhes nyi shu rtsa drug pa'i lhag mar 'gyur ba'i dri ba'i yul la dri ba ni sum cu rtsa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa rnams ji ltar nub pa dang // zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo bzhi'am 'khor lo drug la gnas pa'i rtsa rnams ji ltar mi nub par 'gyur zhes nyi shu rtsa drug pa'i lhag mar 'gyur ba'i dri ba'i yul la dri ba ni sum cu rtsa lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the thirty-fifth question, which is a continuation of the twenty-sixth question, asking about the object of inquiry, “How do the channels located in the four or six cakras not decline?”

original: ji skad du 'chad par 'gyur ba las //🔽de nas bcom ldan rdo rjes gsungs //
analyzed: ji skad du 'chad par 'gyur ba las // de nas bcom ldan rdo rjes gsungs //
translated: As will be explained:🔽Then the Bhagavān Vajra

original: rtsa rnams nub pa'i rnal 'byor ni //
analyzed: rtsa rnams nub pa'i rnal 'byor ni //
translated: taught the yoga of the decline of the channels.

original: de kho na nyid bshad kyis nyon //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bshad kyis nyon //
translated: Listen to the explanation of reality.

original: yul dang dbang po yang dag sbyor //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po yang dag sbyor //
translated: The correct union of objects and faculties

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas brtsams nas ji srid du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas brtsams nas ji srid du /
translated: and so on up to

original: yul rnams dngos po med pa yis //
analyzed: yul rnams dngos po med pa yis //
translated: because objects are unreal,

original: yang dag ye shes de nyid phyir //
analyzed: yang dag ye shes de nyid phyir //
translated: that is the reality of perfect pristine consciousness.

original: de ni la longs spyod phyir //
analyzed: de ni la longs spyod phyir //
translated: Because of that, there is enjoyment.

original: dngos su yul rnams dngos med phyir //
analyzed: dngos su yul rnams dngos med phyir //
translated: Because objects are actually unreal,

original: dbang po rnams ni skye ba min //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni skye ba min //🔽zhes gsungs so //
translated: the faculties are not produced.

original: sbyor pa drug gis ji ltar rtsom //
analyzed: sbyor pa drug gis ji ltar rtsom //
translated: How does one begin the practice of the six-fold yoga?

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the question,🔽the thirty-sixth,

original: sngon du bstan pa'i dri bar co lnga pa las //
analyzed: sngon du bstan pa'i dri bar co lnga pa las //
translated: which is implied in the fifteenth question

original: gang zhig 'khor lo rnams kyi grangs //
analyzed: gang zhig 'khor lo rnams kyi grangs //
translated: concerning the number of cakras.

original: zhes bya ba ni lhag mar gyur pa sbyor ba drug gis sgom pa ji ltar rtsom zhes de'i yul la dri ba ni sum cu rtsa drug pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lhag mar gyur pa sbyor ba drug gis sgom pa ji ltar rtsom zhes de'i yul la dri ba ni sum cu rtsa drug pa'o //
translated: The question is: How does one begin the practice of the six-fold yoga?

original: ji skad du 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
analyzed: ji skad du 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
translated: As it will be explained:

original: de nas gzhan yang bshad kyis nyon //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang bshad kyis nyon //

original: sbyor drug go 'phang mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: sbyor drug go 'phang mtshan nyid ni //

original: ji ltar ji lta ba bzhin sbyor //
analyzed: ji ltar ji lta ba bzhin sbyor //
translated: as they are to be applied.

original: ji ltar grangs kyi dbye ba yis //
analyzed: ji ltar grangs kyi dbye ba yis //
translated: By the division of the numbers

original: rnam pa drug po de las phyed //
analyzed: rnam pa drug po de las phyed //
translated: it is divided into six parts.

original: de bzhin brgyad brgyad de nas brgyad //
analyzed: de bzhin brgyad brgyad de nas brgyad //

original: brgyad gnyis brgya phrag bzhi dang ni //
analyzed: brgyad gnyis brgya phrag bzhi dang ni //

original: de ltar grangs kyi sbyor ba gsal //
analyzed: de ltar grangs kyi sbyor ba gsal //
translated: thus the application of the numbers is clear.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so on.

original: dus kyi mtshan nyid ji lta bu //
analyzed: dus kyi mtshan nyid ji lta bu //
translated: What are the characteristics of the time?

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the question,🔽the thirty-seventh,🔽which is implied in the sixteenth question🔽concerning the time of the practice of the six-fold yoga.

original: bstan ma thag pa'i 'khor lo drug gi rim pas dus gsum mtshon par bya'o zhes de'i don du dus kyi mtshan nyid kyi yul la dri ba ni sum cu rtsa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: bstan ma thag pa'i 'khor lo drug gi rim pas dus gsum mtshon par bya'o zhes de'i don du dus kyi mtshan nyid kyi yul la dri ba ni sum cu rtsa bdun pa'o //
translated: The thirty-seventh question is about the object of the definition of time, in order to illustrate the three times by the sequence of the six wheels just mentioned.

original: ji skad du 'chad par 'gyur pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'chad par 'gyur pa las /
translated: As will be explained:

original: de nas bcom ldan rdo rjes gsungs //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan rdo rjes gsungs //
translated: Then the Blessed One, Vajra,

original: dus kyi mtshan nyid sdom pa ni //
analyzed: dus kyi mtshan nyid sdom pa ni //
translated: the definition of time,

original: rnal 'byor gang gis rnam par shes //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gang gis rnam par shes //
translated: by which yoga one should know,

original: grangs kyi rnal @27a * //
analyzed: grangs kyi rnal @27a * //
translated: the yoga of number,

original: 'byor bla na med //
analyzed: 'byor bla na med //
translated: the unsurpassed,

original: dus kyi dus tshod zhes su bshad //
analyzed: dus kyi dus tshod zhes su bshad //

original: bsam dang bsam min do bo ni //
analyzed: bsam dang bsam min do bo ni //

original: bzang po'i dus dang ngan pa'i dus //
analyzed: bzang po'i dus dang ngan pa'i dus //
translated: the good time and the bad time,

original: rnam pa gnyis ni yang dag gnas //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ni yang dag gnas //
translated: the two kinds are truly present.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so on.

original: gsang ba'i yang ni 'bras bu che //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsang ba'i yang ni 'bras bu che // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The great result of the secret

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus nyams su myong ba'i rjes la gsang ba'i don dang 'bras bu ji lta bu zhes de'i yul la dri ba ni sum cu rtsa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus nyams su myong ba'i rjes la gsang ba'i don dang 'bras bu ji lta bu zhes de'i yul la dri ba ni sum cu rtsa brgyad pa'o //
translated: is the thirty-eighth question about the object of that, asking what kind of secret meaning and result there is after the experience of inconceivable time.

original: ji skad du 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
analyzed: ji skad du 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
translated: As will be explained.

original: de nas gzhan yang bshad par bya //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang bshad par bya //
